Here in {1.String} the pool has started developing some disgusting, green Algae! It seems like its slowly growing and something must be done or it will surely clog up the entire pool! Visit the unit to resolve the issue or Call a Contractor Crew over the phone.

Ugh! Some sort of sickly Blight has started to sneak into the pots and it looks like this requires some extra gardening help! Visit {1.String} of the {0.String} household's unit to resolve the issue or Call a Contractor over the phone!
We're having a Charity Gift Drive over here in {1.String}. Feel free to visit! All donations and gifts are welcome.

Here in {1.String} a string of unfortunate events has been set in motion, and it's starting to feel a lot like a curse. Visit the {0.String} household's unit and locate that cursed culprit or Call a Contractor Crew over the phone to take care of the problem!

Everything is fizzing and popping in {1.String} of the {0.String} household! Neighbors are reporting a power outage due to an Electrical Failure! Visit the unit to sort out the problem or Call a Contractor Crew over the phone.

The neighbors have reported a huge sound of explosion from {1.String} of the {0.String} household's unit. They're scared something else is going to blow. Visit the unit to sort out the problem or Hire a Contractor over the phone!
Here in {1.String}, a Ghost keeps showing up and the {0.String} household is absolutely terrified! Visit the unit to resolve the issue or Call a Contractor Crew over the phone.

Ugh! Here in {1.String} of the {0.String} household's unit, disgusting insects are crawling out of every nook and cranny. Visit the unit to sort out the problem or Call a Contractor Crew over the phone!
Dear Property Owner, the {0.String} household is bidding farewell to the {1.String} Unit. We express our gratitude for the less than satisfactory Residential experience.
Lease Break

The neighbors have reported sounds of hammering from the {0.String} household. Looks like tenants are pooling their efforts to fix and maintain the Residential Rental today! Get involved in the event and save the day!
Property Owner Visit

It appears the {0.String} household in {1.String} haven't deposited rent on time. Action must be taken!\nRemember, you can visit and ask for the rent in person, or even Repossess items to recoup the losses!
Rent Overdue

{1.String} has violated the Maximum Occupancy Rule. Having too many Sims living there is in clear breach of agreed occupancy. Post Fine remotely using the mailbox or Prosecute Fine directly to the Tenant household.

{1.String} has violated the No Loud Noises Rule. The neighbors can't get any sleep and something needs to be done about it! Post Fine remotely using the mailbox or Prosecute Fine directly to face the consequences!

{1.String} has violated the No Social Events Rule. So many random Sims coming and going, and the neighbors are finding it very disruptive! Post Fine remotely using the mailbox or Prosecute Fine directly to put an end to this nonsense!

{1.String} has violated the No Trash Overload Rule. The neighbors wouldn't be surprised if the whole building gets pests! Post Fine remotely using the mailbox or Prosecute Fine directly to the Tenant household to enforce consequences for their misconduct!

The {0.String} household reported a disgusting smell lurking inside of the unit, and it appears sewage is leaking everywhere! Visit the unit to sort out the problem or Call a Contractor Crew over the phone!

Your time has come. The {0.String} household in {1.String} has endured bad living conditions for far too long, and it appears they are on the brink of staging a revolt! Try sending a Conciliatory Letter via the mail, or visit the unit promptly to address their concerns before your Unit Rating potentially takes a hit.
Here in {1.String} of the {0.String} household, the unit is drowning under a mountain of trash. Visit the unit to sort out the problem or Call a Contractor Crew over the phone!

The water is leaking everywhere in {1.String}! So many puddles and no one can even take a shower! The {0.String} household demands something must be done! Visit the unit to sort out the problem or Call a Contractor Crew over the phone!

(From Visiting Sulea Tiger Sanctuary)

Congrats on becoming a Cub Club member and thank you for your generous donation towards the Adopt-A-Tiger Program! Every Cub needs a fluffy friend, so be on the lookout for your plush buddy and an exclusive commemorative poster. This will arrive by mail in one to two business days.\n\nYour contribution is helping tigers thrive in, and out of, the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary and for that we think you're great! Be sure to come back and donate again later.
Welcome to the Cub Club!
(From Thinking About Tiger)

Khun Mae lived a long and fruitful life serving her people. The Tomarani people still honor her and the oath to the tigers of mutual protection.\n\nLegend says her soul continues to pass through the generations of tigers that come after her. If you keep an eye out, you might catch her watching from the brush, ensuring her promise is kept. Others say the glowing eyes are an omen of the Beasts' inevitable return. Regardless, Khun Mae lives on, in truth and in legend, as the Great Mother of Tomarang.
The Great Mother

Below the statue a small plate with an inscription reads: A stone at first glance Not a thorn upon this rose. But no tiger stood a chance, as love had come to blows! A wayward tail of chance, some mixed feelings for a cause. A timid young romance or a steamy tryst with claws? Forget the age old dance. Be together or apart. Find the one or take a stance, A true tiger in their heart. - Love Bite, Juan Cordero

(From Donating to Sulea Tiger Sanctuary)

Thank you for donating to the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary! Your contribution goes towards our conservation and preservation efforts. We are devoted to the protection and recovery of our tigers, so every Simoleon counts!

{0.SimFirstName} removes {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} shoes upon entering, trying not to linger long in the threshold. It's important to be respectful when witnessing the great beauty inside Tinsu Temple. It's hard to believe something this majestic and beautiful can exist so close to home!
(From Visiting Tinsu Temple)
Time for a Tomarang Truth

While I love our current living situation, I hope it's more of a temporary arrangement. I don't want to rent forever. I like to picture us in a beautiful home, down by the water, with floor to ceiling house plants! Liên can even renovate all the rooms if she wants! I think it could be nice, for all of us.

There are spirits all around us! They live in the trees, the water, the sky! It's just something I know deep down to be true. And while there are plenty of good spirits, there are also evil ones, haunting your lampshades and breaking your sinks. You should be careful how you treat people in this life, you never know what they might do to you in their next one.

I've always wanted to go into conservation, but I never took the leap. I knew I was good at programming and having a stable job felt more comfortable. The dream is still there though. That's probably why I'm always visiting the Sanctuary or spending time outdoors. I just want to make our world a better place for all creatures.

If you know the tale of Khun Mae, you'll know why tassels are so special to this area. I always feel such a deep connection when I happen upon one, it's like her spirit is gifting it to me directly. Be sure to look around or simply relax on the beach, you never know when Khun Mae may leave you something special.

I'm quite fond of the Screaming Gecko. It's a lovely place to make new friends and share delicious food. And the hot tub! Talk about making some steamy encounters over late night drinks, amiright? You should check it out! It's like our not-so-secret-secret spot for Tomarang hangs.

Do you ever hear screams in the dead of night? A high shrill sound, piercing the silence, jolting you awake?! The eerie air thick with fear and humidity, as the breathy shriek pauses before announcing itself once more. You look around. You check your doors and windows. Nothing. A bead of sweat rolls down your back. Again it haunts you! Is it aliens descending from above? A being lurking in the shadows? A neighbor in need of help? No. It stings your ears once more. It's down right chilling. You pass by an open window - wasn't this shut before? Maybe, maybe not. You carefully approach, heart pounding, ears ringing. As you look at the windowsill, hesitantly waiting for a ghoul to appear, you see...a gecko.

Growing up, I was taught to greet my parents and grandparents with what we call "Mano". I would bow my head and place their hand on my forehead. It always warmed my heart having that special something between us.
I can trace my family lineage all the way back to the days of Khun Mae. I love knowing how deep my roots go, it makes Tomarang truly feel like home.

Hidden truths are all around us. With enough trust in one another, people are more likely to share what's deep within. Sure, if you snoop around you could find things, but isn't it also nice to just make conversation with the people around you?

Of all the places in Tomarang, Beard Beard Cove is my favorite! I've heard rumors that pirates once camped out there after a storm left them waterlogged. I've yet to find proof, but keep your eyes peeled. I know there's something out there.

I plan on retiring, really I do. I just don't want to admit that I'm at that age. I still have my wits about me. I still have time to use the 'ole noodle before I lose my marbles. I just can't figure out where the years went. How did time escape me?! When did my girls get so grown, and I so old? Don't put things off until the end. Live your best life today, that's what I do.

My obsession with Moon Bears is simple. Arturo literally means "Bear". It's a part of me. It's who I am. And if that seems silly, maybe it is. I've spent so many years with Chánh, it's possible his whimsy is rubbing off on me...

Promise you won't think of me differently? I really became an astronaut in hopes to uncover the truth about Moon Bears. I know they're out there, I just need to do some more research. Even if I have to go up there myself, I will find them before I meet my grim fate.

I once did a talk about intergalactic solar systems with Avelina Lunvik. Her discoveries helped shape so much of my work. This is probably classified, but in my youth I spent some time on Sixam! Beautiful place. No cell service though.

Sometimes an astronaut just needs his space. Thi would be so proud of me for that one. But in all seriousness, I enjoy the focus and silence of the lab. I need to keep my mind sharp! Can't let it turn to jelly in my old age.

I'm not one to share my feelings but you've shown me it can be really rewarding. I tend to struggle revealing my true emotions. Someone has to lead, you know. Someone has to be the caretaker. I need to remind myself that feelings are not weakness. I should share with my son more often. He needs to know he's loved. Everyone does.

Kasem's father, Yao, and I were never married. I always liked a little spice, a little spontaneity. Our love was deep and open to whatever the universe threw at us. I just never expected it to throw in such an early departure. I like to think he's the one always breaking my toilet. That's why I leave extra fruit outside. No need to worry about sugar in the afterlife.

I didn't even flinch when Kasem asked to change his pronouns. Some languages have 30 pronouns, did you know that? Why should I care if it brings him such joy? My Noi. I often wonder if giving him that nickname made him feel small. He has such a big heart, I hope he knows that while he's still my little boy, he's meant to achieve great things in this life.
I just don't use chopsticks. Why would I give up the mighty spoon?! It's a powerful and useful tool. Take it from an elder, don't change what isn't broken.

The Spirit House in front of my home is for the pĭi. I make sure to provide daily nourishment so they stay happy. Kasem thinks I'm silly, but I swear it's kept the spirits out of my home and away from breaking my toilet.

Sometimes I want Arturo to retire. I know it's selfish! But we're old! You can't blame a man for wanting to spend his final days with his best friend. He's smart, but he can also be so dense. Tell him to come home soon, okay? He can't work forever.

Back when I was skippier than a rock, I met my husband in Selvadorada on an expedition. Those ruins are no joke, I was nearly pierced by a poisoned dart! Arturo actually saved me. I had fallen for him, quite literally, over a ledge and into his arms. We traveled a lot together after that, but we finally settled down here. I had told him it didn't really matter where we ended up, his moon can be seen from anywhere! And dang it, I was right!

I know I can be a bit of a goofball, but Thi really kicks it up a notch! I don't always understand half of what she's talking about, but she's a good sport about my jokes, so I can be a good sport about hers. Just watch out when she gets her cringe on, you might get smacked in the melon with an awful joke or two if you stand too close!
You should know, fishing can offer peace and serenity - two things that are hard to come by in a house full of people! Unless you find a babbling brook, those can be just as talkative!

The secret to a good life is finding your passion. Rewards come to those who do. For instance, my passion is fishing. And look! Life rewards me with an abundance of fish friends every time I'm on the water. Arturo taught me that though the river is quick, patience and appreciation are key.

Honestly, I wasn't born with this name, I chose it. Kasem can mean "happiness" or "pure joy", something that once felt unobtainable for me. Sometimes you just have to make your own happiness, or in my case become it!

No one knows this but, I tend to think about the Broman Empire on like a daily basis. It just impacts everything! Social structures, political systems, taxes. If you really sit down and ponder it, you can just about follow any topic all the way back to that major moment in history. Even The Great Sloth Invasion was brought on by the downfall of the Broman Empire! Like, how can you not think about that?!

Nin and I never went on a real honeymoon. We just kept putting it off, trying to save more to make it extra special. What she doesn't know is that I've been secretly planning a trip, just the two of us! I hear Tartosa is quite romantic...I just have to make the finishing arrangements before I can surprise her!
Our son is born from science, isn't that neat? We named him after Koh Sahpa's tigers. We hope it makes him feel strong! We also found it fitting since he kept growling as an infant.
Nin is my gem, my sapphire. It's sappy, I know. But she brings a special light to my life. I could not face this world without her, but that's not really a secret is it?

It's true! I'm a phoney! I strut around in stylish outfits and influence others to bust their wardrobe woes but the real truth is - I LOVE SWEATPANTS. It's all you really need. A good, comfy, scrappy old pair of sweats. That's my inner truth, and yet I can never wear them. It would ruin my brand.

Despite being loud and lively, Thi is definitely hiding something. I'm no snoop, so I'm not even sure how I'm going to figure it out. It's just a feeling I have. If you find out, you don't have to tell me. I want her to open up when she wants to. But keep an eye on her for me, yeah?

I know Alon believes in the legends of Tomarang, but I'm a bit of a skeptic. I mean, I don't even believe in werewolves. If I've never seen one, how can I be sure they really exist? I just focus on what's in front of me and leave the tall tales to my dear Alon.
I became a vegetarian after a chicken nugget clucked at me. No it wasn't undercooked, it was my dad having a laugh. But still! How haunting. I never wanted to eat meat ever again. That poor nugget...

It's my job to track the trends and cultivate a solid fashion sense, but, if I'm being honest, fashion "don'ts" don't really exist. You're style is yours. I think the only fashion faux pas would be wearing nothing at all!

Legend says Khun Mae was temporarily enchanted by the Watcher to transform into a Tiger. She was gifted with ferocious strength and fearsome agility. Could you imagine becoming a tiger? You'd never encounter it today, but it's still pretty wild to think about.

Long ago when Beasts descended upon Tomarang, even after being transformed into a tiger, Khun Mae was not strong enough to face them herself. The Beasts destroyed a third of the land before she even returned with help. With the amount of damage, they never rebuilt and simply allowed nature to return and heal the grounds. I for one enjoy the extra foliage, it's peaceful to be surrounded by so much nature.

Don't you know? Tomarang is known for its relationship with Tigers. Our history dates back to our early ancestors, when sims would live side by side with these majestic creatures. It's our responsibility to preserve their existence you know, just like it was back then. I always frown upon those who try to sneak in at night. Imagine waking a tiger from their beauty sleep! A good way to get eaten if you ask me.

During a perilous time, Khun Mae, before she became the Great Mother of Tomarang, accepted a quest to save the village. An elder set her on a path to seek the great Watcher, a mystical being rumored to dwell in a land not far from here.

I once watched a nail biting round of marbles at the playground in Morensong. Poor kid played for keeps and lost all his marbles! I always wonder what happened to him. Losing your marbles is never a good thing.

You can't say a word. Promise? I may already know about the honeymoon Kasem is planning. It's not my fault! I got home from the gym early one day and overhead him on the phone. I refuse to spoil the occasion though. He's worked so hard on this and it's so incredibly sweet. I want him to still enjoy surprising me, even if I may not be as surprised as I should be.

Kasem's mother and I disagree when it comes to parenting. She can be a bit strict, which isn't really my style. Sud is so little, I just want to provide a gentler approach. But, all that said, I do try to remind myself that Bua raised Kasem, and he turned out wonderful. So it's probably okay, right?

If I'm not at the gym, you'll probably find me with my nose in a book! I've read everything. From Lord of the Swings, to the Dusk Glow trilogy, to Gentlemen Corgi: A Memoir. If it's something that can be read, I must read it! I even found a really old copy of The Log of the First Voyage of Beard Beard the Pirate at a yard sale. Can you believe that? What a find! I couldn't help myself, I read the whole thing right there at the table. I do feel bad I never paid for it, but once I had finished, it seemed silly to buy it... Anyways, that book's plot packed quite the scandal!

As a child, my mother would make roti with condensed milk and sugar. It was so sweet and delicious! Sadly, I lost her recipe while moving around from place to place. I know she added a secret touch, I just hope one day I can remember what it was.

I think if I had a super power it would be napping. I can nap anywhere. One time, I fell asleep in a bush! Just right there, in some nature. Honestly, nap where you must! Getting some good rest is important... Who cares if it's on the ground? Just watch out for twigs, they tend to poke.

Tell you my deepest secret? If I did that I'd also have to introduce you to my friend Grim. Listen, I will neither confirm or deny my secret agency. I'm just trying to keep my family safe. They don't need to worry about me all the time.

I feel really strongly about embracing my cringe. It's like artistic expression! It's a release of emotions! A POSE OF POWER! Ok maybe it's not that serious, but it is a dabbin' good time. Some ladies like a dab of perfume, I like a dab of the 'ol humerus-es. If you're not down for the cringe, what are you down for?
I sometimes sneak into my family's unit and move furniture around. Last time, I just moved everything 1cm to the left. The amount of things my dads bumped into that day! PEAK comedy.

My dream is to own a motorbike. That way I can new scoot goof around town. It would make trips to the store a lot quicker too. I can't just lug bags of groceries home, my ice cream would melt! This way I can scoot aboot and make it home in time for Sunday sundaes in this heat. My favorite sundae is my own concoction, "Goof Foot" ice cream. Don't let the name fool you, it just has loads of toppings.

There was once a rumor going around that break-ins were rampant and small trinkets were being stolen from people's homes. The truth is, I owned a very mischievous cat named Bubs who would commit B&E's, or "Bubbin' & Entries" as I liked to call them. He would steal small tokens and keep them in his stash under the floorboard. I wasn't gonna turn him in! Do you know what they do to overly curious cats with sticky paws!? So I kept it to myself. Haven't told a soul until now.

Truth is, I don't really know how to fix anything. Anytime a tenant needs maintenance I just buy a replacement instead. Last week my tenant's sink was spraying water all over the bathroom and I just bought a new one! I couldn't make the water stop! No matter how many times I hit it with a wrench, the fountain of fury just kept getting worse! I know it probably costs me more, but do you know how boring those fixer upper books are?!

I'm trying to be the best property manager I can be, but I have to admit, I'm not perfect. Did I, at one point, semi-accidentally cause a mold issue in the bottom unit to get the tenant to move out? Yes. And I feel terrible about it! But you must understand, they kept letting their dog pee on the floor! At least... I hope it was the dog... Regardless, I didn't want smelly floors anymore!

I wasn't always so responsible. I partied too much and stayed out all night. I had this wild idea to become a DJ. It was a bit chaotic, the lifestyle. I often wonder where I'd be had Zhafira not needed me. It's funny what life throws at you. I could barely handle my own needs, now I have to be responsible for tenants AND a teenager!

Money can get tight, but we make it work. Renting out the space below doesn't always cover everything, which is why I'm also a barista. I told Zhafira not to worry about helping with bills, but she seems to really enjoy babysitting. I'm concerned it's because she can snoop around people's houses while the kids are napping but I'm too afraid to ask. Plus, I like when she buys me lunch from time to time.

It's not really a secret around here that our parents passed. But not many realize that we carry on our father's name. Last names can be a funny kind of thing. Ours is polynymic with a patronymic, which is really just a fancy way of saying we're named "Cahya's daughter".

I want to move away when I finish school. It's something I've been mulling over for quite some time, but I think I'm fully committed to the idea now. I just haven't told Vanesha yet...To be honest, I'm scared it will break her heart! We aren't very close, and maybe that's my fault, but it would mean leaving her all alone. I just want to travel. I want to explore! Maybe try university. I don't know the details quite yet, but I know I want to try new things and I can't do that here. My whole family has lived here for generations, but without them around, it doesn't really feel like home anymore. I just hope Vanesha will forgive me.

Yes, I broke into Bella Goth's house but DO NOT tell my sister! I had to skip school to even be able to and she'd be furious...mostly about the break-in, but probably about the school too. Listen, I didn't take anything! I just wanted to see what it was like. There are a lot of skeletons in that family's closet. Like, literally.

Most people would say that sneaking around and not minding my own business is a form of acting out. But what if I just like it? Is it really so bad to be nosy? I enjoy the discovery! Don't you want to know about everything around you? Interesting people come in and out of the unit downstairs, I'm just intrigued by them.
I'm not afraid to microwave water! I just choose not to. The kettle is a perfectly normal way to heat water.

It's not a secret that our parents died. However, it is a secret that Vanesha gave up becoming a DJ to take care of me. I don't think she knows I know. It's really strange to watch someone completely upend their entire life just to accommodate you.
(From Finding a Marble)
(From Losing Hopscotch)

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} discussed what their perfect Sunday would look like. A long swim in a pool, a relaxing rest on a rug by the fireplace, a trip to the vending machine, maybe end it looking up at the night sky through a Telescope...

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} spoke about redecorating plans. They agreed that everyone enjoys classic "Leeb, Leefuh, Lurve" decor, but they couldn't settle on if they preferred Young Adult Grey or Bella Red.
{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} had an uneventful chat, but they did cross their arms, and while crossing arms, they readily agreed that crossing arms does make oneself feel pretty cool.

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} debated the sentience of Gnomes. They determined that a Gnome is a Gnome because they look like little Sims. Sims like gifts. Gnomes like gifts, and if Gnomes don't like the gifts then they catch on fire. Fire summons Firefighters, who are Sims. Sims are sentient. Therefore, Gnomes might just be sentient...

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} theorized the distance from their current location to the highest peak of Mt. Komorebi, but then got distracted by thoughts of Yamachan and determined Yamachan needs a new "big muscles look."

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} had a chat about celebrities and their ominous glow. What if a celebrity was trapped in a dark room with no doors or windows (not that that scenario could ever realistically happen, right?)—would they still glow?
{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} had a pleasant conversation of birds and their possible origins. They pondered if they were pointy or if that was just a trick-of-the-eye...

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} theorized about the sudden surge of spying Sims. Where did all the binoculars come from? Why do they need to know all the information? Are they working with the Gnomes?
{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} spoke about their Property Owner, hoping that they weren't overheard. They agreed that it always feels like someone is watching them...
{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} spoke about future getaways. They determined it always felt like there were more and more interesting new places to explore every year.

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} discussed their gratitude for Tiger Inspectors. However, they realized they were a little unsure of what a Tiger Inspector actually does... Do they inspect Tigers for Tiger health or investigate the ever-threat of lurking tigers nearby?

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} discussed the societal judgments of those who microwave Hot Water. What is so upsetting about the concept? And do the societal judgements reflect more on the water or the judgy Sims themselves?
{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} had a discussion of nearby smells. {0.SimFirstName} asked {1.SimFirstName}, "What is your smell?" And {1.SimFirstName} didn't know how to answer.

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} had a strikingly terrifying conversation about mold. While they both agreed that mold is pretty upsetting, they also agreed that mushrooms are kind of cool, and glowing things are also cool. Why then, are glowing mushrooms scary?

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} discussed their fondness for hot tubs. Bubbles. Warm bubbles. Bubbles under the water. {0.SimFirstName} does like bubbles. As does {1.SimFirstName}. Throughout the conversation, these simple neighbors found connection.

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} discussed their goals for the future. They pondered what new and interesting experiences they might discover in life a year from now. They agreed that it always seems like the world is getting bigger and bigger for some reason...
{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} discussed the occasional strange noises coming from within the walls. In the end, they agreed to just ignore the noises from now on. It'll probably be fine.
{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} made small talk about the weather. A truly boring affair, but neither Sim wanted to be impolite and walk away.

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} discussed the meaning of Wisdom. They agreed that true Wisdom was earned with experience and more likely to present itself if a Sim was also skilled in Logic or, frankly, old.

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} had a pleasant chat about appreciating the Generosity of others. Though they both agreed that Generous Sims can sometimes be a bit... zealous in their pursuit of giving.
{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} had a mild but polite discussion about the cost of rent. The conversation didn't last long, and neither Sim was particularly enthralled by the topic.
Neighborly Chat

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} had a colorful discussion about the absurdity of life. They pondered their purpose and the concept of self-autonomy. They asked what it was all for and wondered if in the end they'd be remembered.

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} had a conversation about llamas. They pondered why llamas are such an important symbol in their daily lives. They asked: who started the world's obsession with llamas and why?

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} chatted about mostly nothing. However, in their hearts, they both enjoyed emitting noises from their mouths. It was an unspoken joy. Or was it? Isn't that sort of the point?

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} had a curious chat about the afterlife. They pondered why some Sims became Ghosts and others Skeletons and if a Spector is the same thing as a Ghost? Can a Vampire also be a Ghost? Can a Ghost Vampire drink your blood? They had many questions.
(From Neighbor Nuisance)
Uh oh, is {0.SimFirstName} kinda... you know... Cringe? I mean we've all had our suspicions, but is it time to face reality?\n\nEmbrace the change?
{0.SimFirstName} has been butting into other Sim's affairs lately, going from a reclusive Loner to a unapologetic Nosy Sim.\n\nEmbrace the change?
{0.SimFirstName} is becoming more of a Nosy Sim and doesn't care about being Socially Awkward anymore.\n\nEmbrace the change?

{0.SimFirstName} is a Child of the Village Sim. These Sims thrive when enjoying cultural activities, socializing with community, and participating in local events. They often feel sad when it's been too long since they've had a chance to do any of those things.
Child of the Village Lesson

{0.SimFirstName} is a Cringe Sim! Cringe Sims are easily amused and love to share horrifying puns, inappropriate memes, or out-of-date dances they've seen on the internet. They also excel at Comedy, Mischief, and Videogaming Skills. Only occasionally do Cringe Sims feel a morsel of shame for what they do, but that won't stop them from being their true, authentic selves. And don't worry; they will never die from becoming Hysterical. So let your Cringe Sim flourish, even at the occasional cost of people's patience.
Cringe Lesson

{0.SimFirstName} is a Generous Sim. Generous Sims constantly desire to uplift others and are always willing to lend an ear to someone else's hardships. They get along with just about everyone and prefer to be polite and respectful to others. This allows them to form relationships and improve their Charisma Skill quicker than other Sims.\nHowever, Generous Sims aren't always the best with their finances—particularly when they can't resist giving away a few Simoleons to others outside their household.
Generous Lesson

{0.SimFirstName} is a Nosy Sim. In the world of Secrets and Snooping, Nosy Sims thrive. Nosy Sims have few boundaries and will often attempt to pry the information they crave from other Sims. Not everyone appreciates the enthusiasm of a Nosy Sim, but we all know that won't stop them on their unending quest for hot goss.\nThey'll also gain the Photography and Writing Skills more quickly than most other Sims.
Nosy Lesson

{0.SimFirstName} is a Wise Sim. These Sims have lived a full life of experience and acquired a wealth of knowledge along the way. They enjoy and are more effective when mentoring other Sims with their occasionally unsolicited morsels of wisdom. Throughout the years, they've also learned how to deal with Angry and Uncomfortable emotions more quickly and will gain all Skills faster and increased Satisfaction.\nHowever, sometimes past unwanted memories might emerge from a Wise Sim's mind palace when reflecting on life. It's just a small price to pay for their archive of knowledge.
Wise Lesson

{0.SimFirstName} has mastered the art of snooping for Secrets! As a bonus, along the way, {0.SimPronounSubjective} discovered a lot of tea... This Sim loves the thrill of discovering juicy Secrets about other Sims. What they do with that information has yet to be decided...
Seeker of Secrets

Trait Earned: Home Manager Maven Sims with this trait are more successful solving Tenants' Emergency and Maintenance Events, build stronger relationships with Tenants, and have increased ratings on owned Residential Rentals.

This Sim wants to immerse themselves in everything Tomarang has to offer!
Fount of Tomarani Knowledge

In the realm of literature, there are certain tomes that transcend the mere sum of their printed pages. This particular book, you see, is no ordinary collection of words on paper. Rather, it possesses an enigmatic quality, as if its very essence is interwoven with the fate of a singular individual.
Cursed Book
Nothing to see here folks, just a curtain rod for your wall. No silk related shenanigans with this one. If you don't believe us, check the web!
The Hardly Suspicious Curtain Rod

From the brilliant minds that revolutionized your bedsheets, we are proud to present our next great creation: bedsheets for your walls. Show everyone just how important you are with this towering wall covering.
The I Can't Believe It's Not Silk Wall Curtain

We get it, you love this new material, but please stop calling us asking if its silk. It's not. We understand that it's hard to believe, but you can trust us. Why would we lie to you? Silk is too expensive anyway.
The How Many Times Do We Need To Tell You It's Not Silk Taller Wall Curtain

So you've decided to sue us. Well played, insect. While you may have escaped our webs this time, be warned, we shall return and devour you! *laughs in spider* Wait, how long did that judgmental Sim say we'd be locked up for? The spider queen is not going to like this...
The We Are Going To Jail Tallest Wall Curtain
We did it again. Building off our best selling and patented bedsheet designs, we've gone even bigger and better. Because you deserve the freedom to have the largest bedsheets possible.
The I Still Can't Believe It's Not Silk Cinched Wall Curtain

Your persistence is commendable. We won't hide the truth from you any longer. These curtains are made of silk from our mother, the spider queen. We will cast our webs out into the world and catch you all. Our dominance is assured. Please don't sue us.
The So You Know The Truth Taller Cinched Wall Curtain

Okay, we get it, trying to conquer the world with our webs was a bit of an oopsy. We're past that now, and just want to do spider things with our spider friends for our spider queen. Please consider buying this curtain and supporting the cutest eight legged creatures in town! We promise not to bite youuuuuu.
The Save Us From Ruin Tallest Cinched Wall Curtain
Furry equals friend, and this one needs you more than most. Thanks to your support, Tibert the Tiger can flourish with his family at the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary.
Adopt a Tibert

When the Urbz told you to trade in your wack outfit for some fresh drip, they didn't mean literally. Every day we stray further from what is right in this world, and your complete disregard for sanitation is appalling.
Got That Drip Stain
The latest fashion trends incorporate lived-in looks, so you've decided to apply that principle to your home. How trendy, original, and incomprehensibly revolting.
Dripping Drops of Dross
Goo's in you, goo's in me, goo's in everybodyyyyyy. Nothing makes you feel less alive than celebrating your goo. Make it stop.
Gooey Goo
You've done the impossible. Without a chimney, you've not only managed to create soot, but also to drape your walls with it. Maybe it will help with insulation?
Sooty Spots

Why use paper sheets when the wall can be your notebook! Calculating the slope of a line has never been easier with such a large surface to work with. Your teacher would be proud of your creativity, and slightly terrified of your interpretation of cleanliness.
Grime Graphs

So you've put a hole in your wall. Whether this was through anger or madness, it's a statement, and that is the essence of art. Pouring your emotions onto such a canvas demonstrates creativity and living in the present. I'm sure this pattern of behavior is illuminating a bright future for you.
Befouled Bricks

Behold the fruits of your labor, condensation of perspiration. Your friends may have called your sanity into question for concocting this plan, but you'll show them. The pheromones in this aroma are sure to attract the highest quality mates around. They'll see, you tell yourself, as new life sprouts from your cells.
Raining Rot
"If it's not real, it can't hurt me," you murmur under your breath, as this slop on your walls convulses and writhes. It looks hungry, and you don't want to be around for its next meal.
Fictional Filth

This is a fresh one, you think to yourself, spying new grime in your home. Proud of this accomplishment, you share it with your friends and family, but strangely enough, they stopped replying long ago.
Young Yuck

Scholars of the past were known for their fascination with clouds, their ever changing shape a refreshing spectacle for the eye. Thanks to your unbelievably poor hygiene, you have replicated this phenomena indoors, except with the addition of another dimension: smell. In the name of all that is good in this world, please stop.
Clouds of Crud
Why go hiking outdoors when you can bring the essence of the mountains indoors, courtesy of the wall being your napkin. Your roommates must love you.
Mucky Mountains

That day the girls learned an important lesson about the benefits of collaboration.

One day, a baby bird sprouted from the bud of a leaf. This was a strikingly gorgeous organism, which desired to escape the tendrils from once it came, and soar through the sky in freedom! Each day, it grew a new wing to which it hoped would let it soar. Over time, strange creatures came to observe these transformations, but it paid them no mind, continuing the pursuit of its goal. Soon after, it felt its roots leave the ground, and the sky drew nearer! Oh what a glorious day, all that effort had blossomed. But what's this? Those strange creatures from before were closer than ever, brandishing sinister auras. Plunk! The poor bird was submerged into a new prison, not quite the earth as it was before, but soil nonetheless, with a smooth surface surrounding it. As the days went by, the creatures would gawk at the bird's futile struggles to fly, and it grew weaker. Finally, when the baby bird's time had reached its end, the dream for flight was passed on to its descendants, as it let out one last burst of energy to send its spirit out to the wind, starting the cycle once again.
The Flightless Bird of Paradise

The Environmentally Conscious Dish Rack

It is well-known that Gnomes love mushrooms. The two go together like Father Winter and presents, you know? But this Gnome has an interesting twist. We thought, "What if we cover this Gnome in toxic mushrooms? Won't that be sooo cute?!" It is. Don't mind that he looks slightly worried. Though, if we're being honest, he should probably be more worried. Silly Gnome.
Gnomebody Loves Mushrooms Like a Gnome

Do you hate it when your food touches? Tiffin's do as well, and they've got your back. With four partitioned sections made of tin, your nourishment is sure to remain isolated. These really are the ultimate in take-out technology.
Tactical Tiffin

Unlike other offerings in this catalog, this pillow will give your Sim the back support they deserve! Perfect for relaxing on the floor and reading a book or getting work done. Three cheers for posture!!
Triangle Wedge Cushion
Turn your favorite herbs into delicious spice with the original grinding apparatus.
Mortar and Pestle

Look how cute this teapot is! Isn't it adorable? Well then you won't be surprised to learn that living elephants are also cute and adorable. Let this teapot be a reminder of the beauty of this world, and why it must be cherished while we still have it.
Save the Elephants Teapot

Five out of five user reviews say they are a fan of this wall-mounted air conditioning unit. It turns on and off and cools things, but what else have we been conditioned to expect from such an appliance?
Wall-Mounted Air Conditioning Unit
This Fuse Box does not control electricity. It doesn't really do anything. That's the other Fuse Box. It does look nice though! That's really what it is here to do.
Non-Functional Electrical Fuse Box
The vessels stare at you ominously. Are they friend or foe? With questions like these, maybe you're the real basket case.
Walled Weaves of Wickered Whims

What a beautiful flower, drawing you in with its ornate carved detail. However, it bears a more sinister side. Caution is necessary when in the presence of this death dealer. Whether magnate or employee, flaws will be exploited and lives forever changed through a trial of hubris.
White Lily Wall Art
This artwork is a blessing for your harvest, and a staunch defender of good fortune. Its presence is said to provide solace in times of need. What else do I need to say for you to buy this?
Creature Comforts Carving
Nary a glimmer of light will probe through these wooden slats. Your round windows have never felt so secure.
Yeah That's Definitely Shuttered
Even the freshest faced adventurers can see the value in this artisanship. Making it yours is practically a prerequisite before the journey begins. But how will you get it past the guards?
Limeware Platter

Originally, creators wanted to name this the "Unimpenetrable Security Gate." However, Gary just had to bring up that the actual word was "Impenetrable" and that "Unimpenetrable" would be that it was actually "Penetrable" which has the opposite intended meaning.
Impenetrable Security Gate
What was that sound?! Oh wait... it was the resonation of silence. How tranquil.
Tranquil Bathroom Cabinet
Analyze your pores and mask your socially conditioned flaws with this not vain vanity.
White Lily Vanity Table
Were you expecting some elaborate writeup? Well shelve those expectations, because this is two pieces of wood drilled into a wall.
It's a Shelf

You wake up to a gorgeous sunrise over an equally beautiful ocean. Life is good. After putting on a cup of coffee, you head into the bathroom for the morning routine. Before you stands this smooth, lustrous, tiled box. The next thing you know, you're being rained on, splashes of water wetting your hair and body. You think back to that sunrise you saw earlier, and picture yourself in that ocean. Suddenly you realize, you are the ocean. Drops of you spray onto the floor, but you don't care. You have ascended. What a way to start the day.
Tiled Tide Shower

Sometimes known as the Get Rent Sign. Sometimes known as the Rental Living Sign. Sometimes known as the Discover Rent Sign. Sometimes known as the Renting Together Sign. Sometimes known as My First Rent Sign. Sometimes known as the Luv2Rent Sign. This is just the tip of the iceberg folks.
The For Rent Sign
Suddenly the thought of a cool, refreshing, delicious lemonade enters your agonizingly dehydrated mind. Where did this notion come from?
Subliminal Lemonade Sign
This powerful handheld emblem represents a herald of change. A simple sign that dares to defy the established order, rallying hearts and minds to stand up for any right one wishes to fight for.
Tenant Revolt Sign
If you're looking for a sign to move, this is it. Literally. Well, what are you waiting for?
For Rent Wall Sign
They say one can judge a Sim by their shoes. Well that classist garbage doesn't fly here, because shoes are NOT ALLOWED!! We are dismantling this corrupt and sick world one shoe at a time.
Take Your Dang Shoes Off Sign

Are you a business with not enough warm bodies entering your door? Or dare I say, too many cold bodies?! Then try increasing your Simtention with a sizeable sign! The originally harbinger of adverts, nothing quite takes up wall real estate like a 2D billboard. It's all about discoverability, brand recognition, and subtle hypnosis!
Substantial Shop Sign
Revel in the sheer magnificence of that basin! Get your face nice and close to admire the detail of its creation. Yes, just a little closer now...
White Lily Sink

This famous stool has made its way around the globe, from world stage wrestling matches to your local dive bar. It's reinforced wooden legs are sturdy enough to pack a punch, but also break on impact for dramatic effect.
The Choose Violence Bar Stool
This teak and cane dining chair gives off the commanding presence needed to get what you deserve. Have that difficult conversation you've been putting off, or demand the service you paid for.
White Lily Dining Chair
Life is plastic, it's fantastic. You can take it anywhere, and it will never tear. For plastic is forever, when oil comes together.
The Indoor and Outdoor Plastic Chair
Enjoy your meals in comfort and stability with this beautiful ornate chair.
Tranquil Dining Chair

This teak and cane lounger is inspiring for those that dream to sit. Whether you've had a long day at work, or are still on the clock, the comfort of this chair will provide the brief respite you deserve.
White Lily Lounger

Do you enjoy repositioning yourself hundreds of times, only to find comfort a futile dream outside of your grasp? Well look no further, as this stool will make you realize that standing is pretty great after all.
The Most Uncomfortable Stool Ever
Sit up straight, plant those legs, and flex that core. If you don't, you might fall! But that's what you want, isn't it, you little thrill seeker...
The Back Support is Overrated Rattan Pouf
Congratulations!! You did it, you won the pool party. Please take this gold accented blow up floatie as your reward, and bask in the lap of the ocean, knowing you are literally the best.
Pool Party Float Lounger
Unlock by completing the Pool Party event at Gold level.
This teak sofa ditches the cane in favor of plush cloth padding. The comfort provided by this vessel is the therapeutic relaxation needed during a tense vacation.
White Lily Lavish Sofa
Enjoy the scenic views of the landscape or your television on this well-crafted bench sofa.
Tranquil Bench

By placing this ornate wonder on the corner of one’s property, the subsequent flush of calm can center even the rockiest of auras. Beautiful hand-carved details, which rival even the most picturesque of landscapes, adorn this spectacular structure. By leaving fruit and incense as a gift, one can soothe not only themselves, but also those around them… living or dead.
Spirit House
Relax with company around this ornate coffee table. Its tasteful design will only complement the lovely food eaten off it.
Tranquil Coffee Table
What a puny and unassuming dining table. It only fits four Sims? I'm speaking to the manager!
White Lily Square Dining Table
This table may be humble in stature, however the Sims around it are larger than life. This isn't for dinner parties; it's for family.
Tranquil Square Dining Table
Well that's it. You're done, it's over. This is the end... table.
White Lily End Table
After many years, it's finally time to say goodbye. But you're okay with it. You've lived a long and fulfilling life, and its finally time for a peaceful end... table.
Tranquil End Table

This toilet is the epitome of BlandCo's modern mission. It's the result of countless iterations of ruthless optimization. We've devised the most brutally efficient squat toilet experience you could ever imagine. Walk into a bathroom that has one of these, and all you'll find there is: you, this toilet, and your unshakeable fear of the inexorable passage of time. Now, chop chop! Stance up and get to business.
BlandCo Diddly Squat Toilet

How many squat toilets do you go through to find the one? How many heartbreaks must you endure to find serenity in your bathroom experience? How about we fast forward that process to achieve your dream bathroom. Made possible by the stunning minds at PiscesPlumb, they've brought you the definitive squat toilet experience. With this toilet, every day feels like your birthday. So tell me, what are you waiting for? Pick up this diamond-kissed piece of porcelain and never look back.
The Gold Standard Squat Toilet - By PiscesPlumb

Vrooooom goes the Tuk-Tuk, speeding along the floor. "You'll never catch me!" shouts your imaginary friend, running just ahead. Quick, it's time to accelerate and put an end to this game! Ker-chunk!! You enter fifth gear, and feel the rush of power as you close the distance. SKRRRT, drifting the corner, you're finally in arms reach. You'll win this because you're no goose!
Tuk-Tuk-Goose!!

This bin is home to all things without purpose. That old receipt from 6 months ago that you've kept around just in case? Let it go. The plastic bag from the convenience store you took after telling yourself you'd bring the reusable bag for the 50th time? Send it home. Surely there won't be any consequences that come from this.
Ingester of the Unwanted Trash Bin

This fully operational Water Heater keeps things (but let's be honest - really just water) nice and warm, and it also makes water utility usage more efficient! \n\nPlace it in any Residence, Shared Space, or Rental Unit to provide warm water for all to enjoy. Just make sure you keep it well maintained!
Water Heater
This fully operational Solar Water Heater is the perfect low-maintenance option if you want warm water and also to make water utility usage more efficient—but only when the sun is out.
Solar Water Heater
Additional privacy and beautiful, artistic color, combined in one nice little window. Those Nosy Sims might not be able to look inside, but they can admire the beautiful glasswork from outside.
Stained Glass Tomarani Window
Let the light flow in, casting beautiful, vibrant beachy vibes from Tomarang's coastal scenery.
Stained Glass Tomarani Window - Tall
What does a family look like? It can look like anything. Just peek inside this window and see. Then again, maybe that's a creepy suggestion, so don't do that. Just imagine it.
Looking In Window
Do you ever feel like you're on the outside, looking in? Do you tap-tap-tap on the glass? Don't. You'll smear the glass.
Looking In and Up Window
You can see through these windows, but can you see the pattern in the panes' alignment? Few can and those who have, were driven to madness.
The Secret Maze Window - Short
The pattern on these windows is so complex only the most brilliant of Sims can debunk the secret message hidden within.
The Secret Maze Window - Tall
The pattern in these tiles goes up and up. Is that part of the riddle of their pattern? What could their alignment mean? Is it Aliens?
The Secret Maze Window - Very Tall
This window is so tall and the patterns so complex, that it is undeniably dizzying. Don't stand below it and look up. Don't.
The Secret Maze Window - Super Duper Tall
Leave this window propped open to let in the fresh sea air.
Fisherman's Slats Window - Short
A favorite of fishers in Tomarang. These windows keep out the sun and let in the fresh sea air.
Fisherman's Slats Window - Medium
Let in the fresh sea air from ceiling to floor with this extra tall slatted window.
Fisherman's Slats Window - Tall
This window is named Pauline. She is made of Paulownia wood, and she has two brothers named Paul and Paul who are also windows. Pauline likes diamonds though, hence her diamondy panes.
Paulownia Panes
The bars on this window are strong enough to keep lions and tigers outside. At least that's what we tell everyone.
Lion's Lotus Transom
Strong enough to keep even a lion outside, but a design that's delicate enough to bloom in the hearts of those who gaze upon this window.
Lion's Lotus Window
Sure, Tomarang is known for Tigers, but the artist who crafted these windows likes lions. Most people are okay with that, because lions are fluffier.
Lion's Lotus Window - Tall
This is Paul. He is a shutter made out of Paulownia wood. Some say he is stunning.
Paulownia Shutters
This is Paul's older brother, also named Paul. He is a shutter also made out of Paulownia wood. Some say he is even more stunning than his brother Paul who is just basic stunning.
Paulownia Shutters - Tall

Sometimes you really want to block out most of the world's light. That's what shutters are for! Then again, sometimes you don't want it to be entirely dark. You can have your cake and eat it too with these windows, because of the stained glass at the top!
Stained Glass Tomarani Shutters
The perfect window if you want a really tall, shuttered window with touch of stained glass detailing. Maybe that's specific, but sometimes you know what you need.
Stained Glass Tomarani Shutters - Tall
Let a little X-tra light in—both through the open window and through the beautiful stained glass at the top.
Stained Glass Tomarani Shutters - Open Wide

Sometimes you need a tall, wooden window, with a railing but also shutters that are open wide, and you'd like a little color at the top. You need that very specific thing, and you see this window. That's what it is here for. To be needed.
Stained Glass Tomarani Shutters - Tall and Open Wide
This window is a quiet window. Patient some might say. Perhaps it is the pastels that give it that persona.
Patient in Pastel
This window is even longer than the classic Patient in Pastel version, therefore it must be twice as patient. Indisputable logic.
A Long Wait: Patient in Pastel
Fine molding combined with a more traditional shutter. The flower at the top lets a little extra light through at the top.
Shuttered in Pastel
An extra tall shutter, which has to utilize even more fancy molding to give it the same look as its smaller version.
Shuttered in Pastel - Tall

Welcome to your new home unit! To review your lease details, just head to the Home category on the phone or computer and select Show Tenant Agreement. If you want more insights into your Rent bills, you can find it under Show Bills Information. Thank you for choosing to onboard with me, and I wish you a pleasant stay!

I'm Vanesha, your trusty guide to the world of Residential Rentals! If you've set your sights on becoming a Tenant, I'm thrilled for you. The world is brimming with opportunities, and your neighbors await your arrival. Let's dive in and make the most of it!
Buy a Residential Rental
Convert this lot into a Residential Rental

As a Property Owner, you can convert this lot into a Residential Rental and live alongside your tenants, or you can buy a Residential Rental at a different lot and manage your business remotely. The choice is yours to make!
A tranquil oasis just upstream from any and all commotion. This land rests quietly encased by nature's most relaxing elements complete with a worthwhile fishing spot.
Isda Riverfront
Catch a glimpse of aquatic life floating by or soak up the sun! This inspirational site comes with beachfront access and exceptional views of Koh Sahpa's crystal clear waters.
Tam Nang Sands

Center to town yet still close to nature, a spot like this embraces the best of both worlds. With fountain ambiance and just a minute's walk to a screaming good time, this cohousing haven is a deal for a steal!

When it comes to the Linh-Sadya household, it certainly takes a village. Caring for both a child and elderly parents, Liên and Alon have their hands full. Luckily, with multiple streams of income, making rent is a breeze. A bustling house, on the other hand, is cause for some chaos. Luckily, it only takes a step outside to regain some peace.
Linh-Sadya
Sungai Point
Grandiose and lavish, this suite is close to town essentials and oozing with decorative possibilities!

A household of one may seem lonely, but not with Thi's entire family living above her! Wearing the badge of "Weird Aunt" with pride, Thi's quirky existence extends beyond her interior decorating. However, not everything can be included in her open book. Sometimes solitary has its confidential perks...beyond concealing her clown painting that is.
Linh
11A Sungai Point
The bright side is that the clown painting can be removed once the tenant clears out.
11B Sungai Point
An enticing unit for any family just getting started.
11C Sungai Point
Nestled up the shore, this cozy stilt house is settled just off the path into town. With luscious flora surrounding the grounds, anyone with a green thumb can feel at home.

From traditional roots, the Bun Ma family relies on strong familial bonds to get them through life's ups and downs. Bua insisted her son's family move in with her so that she could help raise her grandson, Sud. He can be a bit clingy at times, but Bua cherishes being able to pass down her generations of wisdom while Kasem and Nin work hard and enjoy newlywed life.
Bun Ma
Hothotok Shore
An open-air local hotspot for social gatherings and steamy exchanges. Whether you're here for live music, the curated cuisine, or just taking a dip, it's sure to be a scream!
The Screaming Gecko
Panya
Apart from the dense streetways, this rocky headland delivers a picturesque view of Shih Sea. And for those who like a bit more bustle, it's only a hopscotch away from the beloved Night Market.
Ro Kaya Rockside
A traditional framework built on a modern foundation. What a great start for any cohousing venture!

Since the unfortunate microwavable water incident that resulted in the loss of their parents Cahya and Wulan, Vanesha has had to take on major responsibilities. As both "Big Sister" and "Guardian", it can be hard juggling a teenager and tenant shenanigans all under one roof!
Cahyaputri
Taka Soi 15
A one floor walk-up to an expansive space overlooking the neighborhood.
09 Taka Soi 15
A simple dwelling with life's necessities and an ease to accessing city life.
08 Taka Soi 15
Center to all that Morensong has to offer, this renovated shophouse is perfect for any lively lifestyle with an out-on-the-town attitude.
Chee-wít Chee-waa Kanto
Filled with luscious flora and fauna, this Garden is a welcome place to relax, restore, and reconnect with nature.
ZoSul Taman Botani

Discover Secrets
Go to another Sim's residence. Select the front door and Eavesdrop, or interact with Mailboxes, Dressers, Beds, Desks, or other objects to Snoop. Imagine the secrets to be discovered!
Snoop for Secrets
Poke around another Sim's belongings to uncover secrets! Try snooping through Trashcans, Dressers, Beds, Desks, Mailboxes, or Bookshelves to start out.
Eavesdrop on Sims
Select another Sim's front door and choose to Eavesdrop. You can also find two Sims who are having a conversation and choose the Eavesdrop option in the Friendly Social Category's Gossip menu.
Confront a Sim with a Secret

Discover a Secret about a Sim by Snooping through their things or Eavesdropping on them. Then, choose to Confront them about that Secret by interacting with them. You can find this interaction in the Friendly conversation menu in the Gossip section.
Keep a Secret

Discover a Secret and Confront a Sim about it. After that, make a commitment to keep it. Do this by interacting with the Sim that's secret you know and choose the Friendly conversation menu and then Gossip. From there you can Keep Secret.
Discover Secrets by Eavesdropping
Break Into a Home
Knock, knock! Hopefully, no one is home! Travel to a residence your Sim doesn't own. Select the front door and choose to Break In.
Find a Tiger Inspector Badge
Visit the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary in Tomarang's Koh Sahpa Neighborhood at night. You might just get a souvenir when you Sneak into the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary.
Blackmail a Sim

Find a Secret by Snooping through a Sim's stuff or by Eavesdropping. Then, after you've confronted them about the Secret, you can choose to Blackmail them. To do this, select the Sim that's Secret is known. Then choose the Mean Conversation category in the Pie Menu and choose Malicious to Blackmail.
Live in a Residential Rental

On a Phone or Computer, choose to Move Household. Ensure the lot you are moving to is a Residential Rental Unit. This is a Venue type that can be set while editing a Lot in Build Mode. Move into the Residential Rental as a Tenant, not a Property Owner.
Meet a Residential Rental Neighbor
Hang out in shared Residential Rental spaces and wait to spot your neighbors. Then head over to greet them to introduce yourself.
Have the Property Owner Visit Your Unit

Need a hand around the unit? The Property Owner is here to save the day! Access the Phone's Home Menu and ask the Property Owner to Visit or choose Invite to Hangout at Current Lot in the Relationship panel at the bottom right of the screen.
Fix Something during an Emergency or Maintenance Event

When a Maintenance or Emergency Event happens, let your Property Owner know! You can invite them over in the Phone's Home menu. Your Sim can also roll up their sleeves and solve the Event's issues on their own.
Host a Neighborhood Potluck or Pool Party Event
Time to party! Using the Phone or Calendar, host a Neighborhood Potluck or Pool Party Social Event.
Use an Amenity in a Shared Space
Use an Amenity in the Shared Space of your Residential Rental. Tip: Try using Gym Equipment, Garden Pots, Grills, or Stoves to start.
Achieve Gold in a Neighborhood Potluck or Pool Party Event
Using the Phone or Calendar, host a Neighborhood Potluck or a Pool Party Event. Complete Goals within the allotted time to achieve Gold.
Become Good Friends with Your Property Owner
Perform Friendly or Funny interactions with your Property Owner to build a strong relationship.
Successfully Break a Unit Rule
Everyone needs to live life on the edge from time to time. Go to your Phone's Home menu and choose to Show Tenant Agreement to see your active Unit Rules. After that, break a Unit Rule!
Leave Fruit or Incense at a Spirit House
Place the Spirit House from Build Mode. Then choose to either leave fruit or incense as an interaction on the object. Tip: These items aren't needed prior to interacting with the Spirit House.
Use Tomarani Introduction
Find a Sim that the active Sim hasn't met yet. Then use the Tomarani Introduction interaction.
Meet a Sim with the Child of the Village Personality Trait
Explore Tomarang and get to know some of the local Sims!
Use a Squat Toilet
Purchase a Squat Toilet from Build Mode! Then select it to use it.
Cook Tomarani Cuisine

Click on a Refrigerator, Stove, Pressure Cooker, or Grill to cook Tomarani Cuisine. Recipes include: Halo-Halo, Nasi Lemak, Burmese Samosa Soup, Steamed Rice, Banh Xeo, Banh Cuon, Malaysian Satay, Bibingka, Khao Niao Mamuang, Tofu Pad Thai, or Pancit Bihon.
Buy a Shirt from the Night Market
Visit the Morensong neighborhood in Tomarang. Find the Night Market Stalls and buy a one-of-a-kind shirt! Night Market Stalls are only open from 6PM to 2AM.
Buy Food at the Night Market
Visit the Morensong neighborhood in Tomarang. Find the Night Market Stalls and try some of the local cuisine! Night Market Stalls are only open from 6PM to 2AM.
Prepare a Recipe Using a Pressure Cooker
Purchase a Pressure Cooker and counter from Build Mode. Then cook up a meal!
Collect Unique Tassels

Visit the Night Market in Tomarang's Morensong neighborhood. Interact with the stalls to see if any Tassels are being sold. To complete this objective different Tassels will need to be found. You can also find them in piles of sand on Koh Sahpa neighborhood's beaches or when exploring Koh Sahpa's Sulea Tiger Sanctuary or the cave at Beard Beard Cove.
Explore Tomarang's Cave
Swim to the Beard Beard Cove in Tomarang's Koh Sahpa neighborhood. Then choose to Explore the cave.
Explore the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary
Visit the Koh Sahpa neighborhood in Tomarang during the day. After finding the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary, choose to Visit Sanctuary.
View the Statue of Khun Mae and the Tiger
Tomarang's Koh Sahpa Neighborhood holds many tails of days passed. Explore this area and try to find the statute of Khun Mae and the Tiger. Then select it and choose to View.
Have a Unit Occupied by a Tenant

Purchase or create a Residential Rental. This can be done in the Phone's Business category, Owned Businesses Panel at the bottom right of the screen, or in Build Mode by turning your home lot into a Residential Rental.\n\nAfter that, open the Owned Businesses panel, choose the lot you would like to put up for rent and select Fill Vacancy. On the Application menu you can select an Available Tenant to move into a Residential Rental. You can also move a tenant in manually in Manage Worlds.
Handle a Maintenance Event
Keep your Tenants happy by tending to Maintenance Events. When a Maintenance Event occurs, visit the Rental Unit and sort out the issue.
Perform an Inspection Pass
Visit a Rental Unit that your Sim owns. Select various breakable objects and choose to Do Inspection and Maintenance. Tip: Start with Toilets, Sinks, Showers, or Ovens.
Handle an Emergency Event

Your Tenants will have Emergency Events from time to time. You can either travel to their lot to manually solve the issues yourself, or you can hire a Contractor Crew. To hire a Contractor Crew to help out, use the Phone and in the Home menu choose either Cheap or Expensive Contractor Crew.
Have a Unit with a Rating of 3 or Higher

Size, Amenities, Environment, and Maintenance all affect a Rental Unit's Rating. To earn a higher Unit Rating, keep Rental Units in pristine condition by handling maintenance events on time, repairing broken objects, furnishing with expensive objects and décor, and investing in spacious accommodations for your tenants.
Have Two Units Occupied by Tenants

Purchase or create a Residential Rental. This can be done in the Phone's Business category, Owned Businesses Panel at the bottom right of the screen, or in Build Mode by turning your home lot into a Residential Rental. \n\nAfter that, open the Owned Businesses panel, choose the lot you would like to put up for rent and select Fill Vacancy. On the Application menu you can select an Available Tenant to move into a Residential Rental. You can also move a tenant in manually in Manage Worlds.
Perform Inspection Passes on Rentals
Visit a Rental Unit that your Sim owns. Select various breakable objects and choose to Do Inspection and Maintenance. Tip: Start with Toilets, Sinks, Showers, or Ovens.
Achieve a 5 Star Rating on a Unit

Size, Amenities, Environment, and Maintenance all affect a Rental Unit's Rating. To earn a higher Unit Rating, keep Rental Units in pristine condition by handling maintenance events on time, repairing broken objects, furnishing with expensive objects and décor, and investing in spacious accommodations for your tenants.
Become Good Friends with a Tenant
Perform Friendly or Funny interactions with your Tenants to build a strong relationship.
Have Three Units Occupied by Tenants

This railing is named after the Tomarani Twist, a dance made popular in Tomarang. See the vertical, twisty pattern. That's how it got the name. Inspiring. Truly.
The Iron Tomarani Twist Railing
Like the matching fence, this railing is made of stone cold, cool iron. It is simple. It is modern. And it isn't leaning to the side. That's part of what makes it so cool.
Leaning Downward but Not to the Side Iron Railing
A traditional, wood railing, built in a classic Tomarani style. This railing pairs perfectly with the Traditional Tomarang Fence.
Traditional Tomarang Railing
Sugarcane Juice
Make Sugarcane Juice

Sugarcane Juice is a sweet drink that has global appeal. It is often made by street vendors in India, Pakistan, Brazil, and the United States. The juice is extracted using a mill that peels and crushes the sugarcane itself.\n\nVegetarian-safe, Lactose Free

Kopi Luwak

Light Roast
Medium Roast
World's Finest Hot Water
It's water, except hot.
Builder's Tea
Brew Builder's Tea
Ca Phe Trung
Make Ca Phe Trung
Start with a cup of very strong coffee, add custard made of condensed milk and whipped egg yolk, and out comes a Vietnamese drink that feels a bit like dessert in a cup.\n\nVegetarian-Safe
Thai Iced Milk Tea
Thai Iced Milk Tea
Make Thai Iced Milk Tea

This drink has its roots in - you guessed it - Thailand, where its distinctive orange color and rich, sweet flavor make it a lovely treat on a hot, sunny day. This tea is made with just a few simple ingredients: black tea mix, sugar, and condensed milk.\n\nVegetarian-Safe
Burmese Samosa Soup
Cook Burmese Samosa Soup

Samosa, by itself, is already perfect. Who doesn’t love deep-fried anything, especially if it’s filled with a spicy variety of veggies or meat. But someone chose to push the envelope and add samosa to a rich lentil soup (dal), creating the popular street food, Burmese Samosa Soup.\n\nVegetarian-safe, Lactose Free
Nasi Lemak
Make Nasi Lemak

Rice, coconut milk, and pandan leaf- there’s a combination for you! Nasi Lemak, also known as Coconut Rice, is the national dish of Malaysia for a reason. Its rich, unique flavor pairs wonderfully with a variety of toppings, and is often served in a banana leaf.\n\nVegetarian-Safe, Lactose Free
Khao Niao Mamuang
Make Khao Niao Mamuang

Khao Niao Mamuang, or Mango Sticky Rice, is made with sweet rice, coconut milk, and mango. Often topped with sesame seeds or mung beans. This dish makes for a wonderfully sweet dessert but is just as good as a morning meal.\n\nVegetarian-Safe, Lactose Free
Banh Cuon
Make Banh Cuon

Steamed rice rolls filled with mushrooms, jicama or cucumber and pork are a popular Vietnamese dish dating back likely to the beginning of rice farming itself in Vietnam. Generally, these rolls are dipped into nuoc cham but sometimes coconut milk, instead!\n\nLactose Free
Banh Xeo
Make Banh Xeo

If you’re out looking for street food in Vietnam, Banh Xeo is your best bet. “Xeo” is an onomatopoeia for the sound made when rice batter sizzles in the pan after it’s been poured to cook this stuffed crepe; Banh Xeo is often dipped into a garlic fish sauce and can be served filled with meat, herbs, pickled vegetables, and more. While there are many stories about the origins of Banh Xeo, one culture with which this food has been associated are the Chams of Central Vietnam. A variant on Banh Xeo can be found in Cambodia, where the turmeric crepes are a bit thinner.\n\nLactose Free
Bibingka
Make Bibingka

Bibingka is a Filipino dessert combining fermented sticky rice (galapong) with sugar and coconut milk that’s often baked wrapped in banana leaves and serves as a wonderful winter holiday treat, which pairs perfectly with a good cup of tea.\n\nVegetarian-safe, Lactose Free
Halo-Halo
Make Halo-Halo

Halo-Halo is a little rainbow all in a single dish. This tasty “mix” of flavors is a Filipino summertime treat, made by combining shaved ice, gulaman, fruits like jackfruit, bananas, mango, and kamote and sweet beans along with young coconut, tapioca, ube jam, flan, and ice cream. To sum it up: once you’ve tried Halo-Halo, your life will certainly become sweeter all around.\n\nVegetarian-safe
Malaysian Satay
Make Malaysian Satay

While there are a few different varieties of chicken satay, Malaysian Satay sets itself apart with cumin, turmeric, or other herbal flavors. It pairs nicely with a peanut satay dipping sauce, which often contains a hint of tamarind and palm sugar.\n\nLactose Free

Combine the delicious sour-sweet tang of tamarind paste with stir-fried rice noodles, tofu, peanuts, and bean sprouts and a meal is created that's so delicious it’s actually one of Thailand’s national dishes. Though Tofu Pad Thai is a more recent invention, it’s combination sweet, sour, and salty flavors are timeless indeed.\n\nVegetarian-safe, Lactose Free
Tofu Pad Thai
Make Tofu Pad Thai
Pancit Bihon
Make Pancit Bihon

A quick, easy, stir fry! Pancit Bihon is made with rice vermicelli noodles that are nice and chewy once fried up. Add in some meat and vegetables and some oyster sauce and this Filipino dish becomes quite the crowd-pleaser! There are variations on this all over the Philippines, but it actually owes some debt to Chinese cuisine as well.\n\nLactose Free
Steamed Rice
Make Steamed Rice

Far from ordinary, there’s truly something special about steamed rice. It’s one of the most commonly prepared foods in the entire world, and it serves as the foundation for a number of dishes. Ask your friends about washing or draining rice for a lively discussion!\n\nVegetarian-Safe, Lactose Free

Grown from humble roots off the coast of Shih Sea, Tomarang is lively with local fare, community chaos, and legends of lore. Known for its tight-knit communities and sun-filled shared spaces, Tomarang is a lush landscape of possibilities. Come cozy up with nature or fish around for neighborly niceties and whim-simsical secrets. Whether you're flying solo or raising generations, this region offers a warm welcome to any multi-living lifestyle! Sul Sul De-Kah!

Cannot go to Build Mode during an Event.
Pool Algae

Looks like the pool is getting invaded by nasty Algae! These nature's rebellious invaders will surely start to take over unless something is done about it. Sort out the problem by selecting to Pour in the Chemical Algae Destroyer. You can even attempt to Swim to Clean Algae, but this might not be enough to address the issue permanently.
Garden Blight

It appears sickly Blight has started to sneak in on your plants! These mischievous garden gremlins will make your once-vibrant plants decay unless something is done to address it. Attempt to revive the dying plants by selecting Deploy Blight Spray. You can even try to Uproot the plants, but that might not be enough to keep the Blight away.
Charity Gift Drive

Partake in this heartwarming event as the community comes together to extend a helping hand for those in need! If you wish to contribute, locate the mailbox and select to Mail Item for Charity. If you'd rather hold onto all your belonging to yourself and give this event a pass, supposedly followed by a little shame of guilt, that's perfectly fine as well!
Cursed

A Cursed book has suddenly been spotted! This book appears to be more than just a collection of printed words, as unexplainable events seem to keep happening... Destroy the Cursed Book permanently, or dare to Mail away the Cursed Item. Keep in mind, this book has chosen you, your destiny remains entwined; its return may simply be inevitable...
Electrical Failure

Everything is fizzing and popping and this residential is experiencing an Electrical Failure! All electrical objects are now broken as a result. Attempt to sort out the Electrical Failure problem by repairing or replacing all broken objects.
Explosive Malfunction

Might be faulty wires? A gas leak? Unreticulated splines? It looks like this place is undergoing an Explosive Malfunction! Attempt to fix the Explosive Malfunction by repairing or replacing all broken objects.
Haunting

This place looks like it's getting haunted by a lingering Ghost! The residents of this household are feeling the chill creeping up their spine and something must be done about it! Attempt to sort out the problem by choosing to Exorcise the possessed object. You can even try to Confront the Ghost but some are just more stubborn than others.
Insect Infestation

This place is becoming an insect metropolis! Sort out the Insect Infestation problem by selecting Deploy Fumigation Device. You can even try to Stomp on the Bugs, but this might not be enough to keep these gravity-defying pests away!
Maintenance Day
It looks like Tenants are gathering together with helpful hands and shared responsibilities to spruce this place up! Contribute by Cleaning or Fixing objects in the Residential Rental!
Neighbor Nuisance

It looks like this household, including others, are now sick and tired of all the noise and smell coming from the neighbors! Living in a Residential Rental comes with its price, but they just can't put up with it anymore! Open up the phone Home category and select Call Property Owner to Sort Out Neighbors or Leave a Passive Aggressive Note by selecting a neighbor unit's door.
Sewage Leak

The drawings depict the story of a battle fought long ago, of beasts, tigers, and people. The Great Mother, embracing her alternate form as a tiger, found the tiger pack she had been searching for fetching water from a trickling stream. Asking for forgiveness and begging for their help, she promised her people would care for all tigers until "the moon became the sun." They agreed to lend aid. Upon their return to the village clearing, a fierce battle ensued between the tiger pack and the wretched beasts that had been ravaging the land. Together, they began to push back on the invasion, but as time passed, The Great Mother could feel her powers waning. Just when it felt like the tides were turning for the worse, something unexpected happened: an elder mistakenly made his way into the open. A beast caught sight and lunged right for him! In a moment of sacrifice, the Great Mother dove between the two, using the last remnants of her powers to save her elder. With a slash from the beast, Great Mother was split in two - a human form, and a tiger form. A piece of her soul remained within her cat counterpart. In fear of this revelation of power, the beasts retreated back into the depths of the forest.
