Ask About Current Conservation Efforts

Continuing the population of tigers is a big part of conservation, which is why it's such an exciting time when cubs are born. Guests can even become a part of our Cub Club by donating towards our Adopt-a-Tiger Program!\n\nWhile you won't be able to adopt an actual tiger to bring home, you do get an adorable plushie as a stand-in. Every bit of support helps us monitor and care for the tigers of Tomarang, from the tiniest newborn to the eldest cat!

Conservation efforts work towards restoring habitats for endangered species and preventing negative external forces from causing harm! Here at the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary, tigers are cared for and protected while they roam free in their natural habitat. Our care can be temporary or lifelong depending on the needs of our animals. More often than not, visitors won't even catch a glimpse of one, but you can definitely hear them!

The focus of the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary is not solely on our local tigers. Our efforts span outwards across other regions, seeking to protect similar habitats where tigers can thrive.\n\nWe've had some pretty famous supporters as well, including Judith Ward after she starred in A Tiger Talks. The experience she had on set left her feeling fiercely philanthropic! There's a lovely plaque somewhere thanking her for her donations.
Ask for Fun Facts About Tigers

A group of tigers is called a Streak or an Ambush! While tigers are typically solitary animals, they will sometimes form groups to care for cubs or to hunt for food. The last thing anyone would want is to be ambushed by an Ambush!

Like most members of their genus, tigers have various forms of communication. Because of their flexible larynx and hyoid apparatus, they can't purr like your typical house cat, but it does give them what they need to let out a ferocious roar! They are also known to growl and chuff. Scent marking and tree scratching are used as a silent way to let other tigers know this area is claimed.\n\nWhile cute, tigers are wild animals and should not be approached. A snuggle today could mean trouble tomorrow!

Tigers live in tropical rainforests, deciduous, evergreen, subtropical and tropical dry broadleaf forests, including the areas surrounding Tomarang. They are incredible swimmers, able to cross large rivers with ease. Tigers are also nocturnal creatures, which is why Sims may just catch a glimpse of them in the brush after sunset.

In the lobby, a resident conservationist is getting ready to start a Q&A session with a group of enthusiastic Sims. Perfect timing. Eager to learn more, {0.SimFirstName} hurries along to join in, already raising a hand to ask the first question!
Conservation Station
A shiny plaque reads: Conservation Support Funded by Judith Ward - Actress, Philanthropist, VIP Cub Club Member.

That Plaque Sure Is Shiny!

A poster with a small piece of paper taped to the edge is hung under a sign for Tomarani Tributes. {0.SimFirstName} unfolds this mystery note to read: Generations long ago, the sleepy fishing village of Tomarang sat just off the coast of the Shih Sea. Tigers were known to walk the tree line, protecting the village from any danger that lurked within the surrounding forests. Villagers honored their guardians by offering food from their abundant riverways. But as time went on, the small village grew in size and their leader began to redistribute resources away from the tigers. Without any provisions at the forest's edge, the tiger pack withdrew to seek sustenance elsewhere. It wasn't long before the village faced the dire consequences of this loss, as beasts began to descend upon them. Hm. The note ends there, but the story feels unfinished. How strange.

It was a weird moment for {0.SimFirstName} and a weird moment for everyone else in the sanctuary too. It was probably the lack of context around someone randomly meowing that set the tone.
Small Meow

{0.SimFirstName} heard a tiger roar back in the distance! Are we friends now? Probably not, but the call and response is very satisfying. It's not every day {0.SimPronounSubjective} can chat with a tiger.

That was far more awkward than expected. Everyone just stared. As the reality of events set in, the sweat began to roll down {0.SimFirstName}'s back. Maybe it would have been cool if a tiger had actually responded, but with only crickets in the air, safe to say that was a major faux paw.
Strong Roar
{0.SimFirstName} is so excited to potentially catch a glimpse of the tigers and the anticipation is too much to handle. With a burst of joy, {0.SimPronounSubjective} lets out a...

Hack It

Nothing beats the open road, breathing in all of that fresh air! It's always nice to step out of the normal day to day and go on a job out of town. Well, that would be the case if {0.SimFirstName} remembered to properly pack {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} tools this morning. Tough It Out

The wind and rain can be pretty punishing, especially to the businesses here in Tomarang. It appears that one of our local vendors is desperate for help, as their market stall is on the brink of disaster! It's still coming down pretty hard out there and may not be safe for {0.SimFirstName} to offer help at this time.

Conserve First
Plants Not A Priority

{0.SimFirstName} heads out to a beautiful forest beyond the Koh Suhpa neighborhood to see what the next job entails. {0.SimFirstName} meets with a Sim who is requesting {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} expertise concerning a tree that has been threatening to fall for quite some time. It becomes pretty clear that this job will require a lot of skill to expertly prevent the tree from falling and damaging whatever is in its path. As {0.SimFirstName} looks around and inspects the site, it looks as though some of the greenery surrounding the tree resemble a rare and protected plant species. Things just got more complicated.

Dive to Retrieve

Fresh air, tranquil waters, and the sound of {0.SimFirstName} screaming into the open landscape. Why the screaming? Well, {0.SimFirstName} accidentally knocked {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} entire toolbox into the river, causing some of its contents to spill into the depths below.

Underquote
Overquote

75 plus 29... carry the 1... This job is proving harder to estimate for {0.SimFirstName} than {0.SimPronounSubjective} had anticipated. On one hand, setting the price higher will account for any extra time spent that {0.SimFirstName} can't plan for. On the other hand, quoting too low will set {0.SimFirstName} back in time and money.

Take Advice
Ignore Advice

While on the job {0.SimFirstName} bumps into a particularly egotistical handyperson, dead set on spreading their own brand of truths. {0.SimFirstName} is working on a difficult maneuver, so of course this rival feels the need to swoop in to give their 2 cents.

Show Caution

Sometimes extra courage needs to be summoned in order to get the job done. This call from the Sulea Tiger Santuary is exactly one of those times. {0.SimFirstName} is tasked to repair the tiger pen to ensure safety for all... but what about {0.SimFirstName}'s safety?
Danger Pay
Use Best Parts
Use Cheapest Parts

While cautious to handle such an expensive item, {0.SimFirstName} is certainly excited by the prospect! The client is looking to upgrade their valuable, high quality machine, and {0.SimFirstName} finds out that the difference in part prices is astronomical. Does the price for parts really align with their quality?
Ultimate Upgrade

Unfortunately the neighbor isn't buying what {0.SimFirstName} is selling. Defeated and ashamed for trying to put one over on the neighbor, {0.SimFirstName} apologizes and finally completes this task correctly and slinks away.

When the angry neighbor looks the other way, {0.SimFirstName} is able to retrieve the missing bolts from {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} pocket and make quick work to put things as they should be. That was a close one!

What is this? Amateur hour? The neighbor is pretty ticked off (and very wet from toilet water) that they let the insults fly in {0.SimFirstName}'s direction. Luckily the fix was fast and {0.SimFirstName} was able to leave in a hurry, but not before getting pummeled with some uncomfortable consequences.

The scowling neighbor quickly changes appearance from angry to understanding, then busts out in laughter when {0.SimFirstName} shows them that the bolts are still in {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} pocket. No harm, no foul, just a little water on the floor to deal with after fixing the mistake.

You know what they say, you can't fit a square peg into a round hole. Well in this case, you can't fix a sink with a corkscrew! {0.SimFirstName} should have known that this would never work. Now there is extra damage to deal with and lost time to make up.

Where there's a will, there's a way! {0.SimFirstName} comes up with a solution, relying on {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} quick thinking, creativity and just a little luck. Who knew that {0.SimFirstName} could be so resourceful?

Unfortunately this was an urgent job and the lost time meant some very angry messages blowing up {0.SimFirstName}'s phone. Sigh. Grabbing the missing tools and heading back to the site took longer than expected, making this mistake a costly one.

At the end of the day, a job well done is a well done job. {0.SimFirstName} figured that trying to hack up some half baked solution could work, but it's always best to do the job right the first time. Luckily urgency wasn't a factor and the job was completed relatively quickly, even with the lost time of heading back to retrieve the missing tools.

It was a bad idea to tempt the angry weather gods today! It was one unfortunate event after another: It started with a mangled umbrella, then a muddy fall, and ending with a banged up knee; all before arriving at the market stall. At least the vendor was kind enough to bandage {0.SimFirstName}'s busted knee.

What's a little bad weather when businesses are at stake? {0.SimFirstName} decides to brave the storm and lend a helping hand to repair the market stall before it can be hit with more damage. The vendor is so pleased with {0.SimFirstName}'s bravery that they thank {0.SimPronounObjective} with some extra Simoleons and shelter from the storm.

Though it was a difficult decision, {0.SimFirstName} decided that it's just too risky to brave the storm right now. Unfortunately this resulted in more damage to the market stall and a very angry vendor calling to complain.

{0.SimFirstName} reluctantly declines to weather the storm and promises to lend a helping hand when things clear up. Surprisingly the vendor takes this in stride and understands that safety is paramount, and even pays in advance for {0.SimFirstName}'s services.

{0.SimFirstName} realizes that {0.SimPronounSubjective} may be in over {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} head on this one! Unfortunately one wrong pull of a branch from {0.SimFirstName} brought the whole tree down, destroying everything in its path, including the rare plants that {0.SimFirstName} desperately wanted to save.

With a steady hand and an expert eye, {0.SimFirstName} is able to remove the dead and decaying branches that were pulling the tree to its demise. With a little added support system, and some hard work, this tree is saved and looking better than ever! As a bonus, no plants were harmed during this mission.

Time is money and {0.SimFirstName} knows that if this job isn't done quickly, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will be in even more hot water. Sadly {0.SimFirstName} could have been more careful working around the rare plants, as after the job was done, {0.SimFirstName} noticed a pretty large patch of trampled greenery. Not a good look for {0.SimFirstName}.

While these plants may have looked rare, on closer inspection {0.SimFirstName} realizes that they are indeed just common weeds. Luckily too, since {0.SimFirstName} wasn't very careful about keeping them safe.

The river is proving to be a more challenging foe than anticipated. A little water isn't going to stop {0.SimFirstName} from completing this job! {0.SimPronounSubjective} may be a little wet (and a little smelly) but {0.SimFirstName} is able to pull through, find the missing tools, and get the job done.
{0.SimFirstName} peers into the watery abyss that has swallowed up the toolbox and its contents. Well, it was high time to buy new tools anyway, though they will be pretty costly to replace.

{0.SimFirstName} decides to push on and finish the job without the required tools. {0.SimFirstName} is not very happy with what {0.SimPronounSubjective} accomplished, and even more dissatisfied with having to buy new tools.
The client raises one eyebrow and busts out laughing when hearing {0.SimFirstName}'s quoted amount. "I thought you were experienced?" Well, {0.SimFirstName} certainly isn't laughing at that one.

The job was a bit more work than expected. The client was happy to save money, even though it meant {0.SimFirstName} had to put in some unpaid hours. {0.SimFirstName} should have taken more care with {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} estimate because the client is very unhappy and unwilling to pay the full amount. It's not the first time that {0.SimFirstName} has been accused of being dishonest, but hopefully it will be the last.

If you want quality work, then you need to be willing to pay for it. {0.SimFirstName} knows {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} worth, and the client is willing to pay extra for {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} skills.
It looks like {0.SimFirstName} learned the hard way that not everyone has the best intentions when giving advice... and this was particularly bad advice causing a massive disruption in the job.
{0.SimFirstName} is humble enough to know that there is still a lot to gain from listening to others. Fortunately this rival had some nuggets of wisdom to share.

It can be difficult to stand your ground, but {0.SimFirstName} feels assured in {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} skills and confidently goes with {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} gut, proving that {0.SimFirstName} is the superior Handyperson!
Caution is understandable, but {0.SimFirstName} taking hours to do a 10 minute job is a little excessive. The bright side? {0.SimFirstName} did not end up in a tiger's tummy.

{0.SimFirstName} isn't about to get eaten by a tiger on the job, that's for sure! A carefully constructed plan of action allows {0.SimFirstName} to finish the job in spectacular fashion... all in one piece!

As {0.SimFirstName} begins to take out {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} tools to work on repairing the pen, a startling growl makes {0.SimFirstName} almost jump out of {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} skin! {0.SimFirstName} leaps out of the pen in just enough time to avoid being this tiger's dinner!

Luck is on {0.SimFirstName}'s side today! {0.SimFirstName} just learned first hand that even if one uses the best parts, skill is still the ultimate decider on how the final product will function. Maybe {0.SimFirstName} needs a skills refresher!
When dealing with a machine of this worth, {0.SimFirstName} knows that you can't cheap out on parts. {0.SimFirstName} completes this upgrade with skill, finesse, and a job well done.

There is nothing more embarrassing than working on upgrading an expensive machine and then having it malfunction right before your client's eyes. {0.SimFirstName} learned a lesson today: Don't cheap out on your clients.
Cheap sometimes can work out, especially if you are as creative as {0.SimFirstName}! It's win-win!
Abandoned Smeagie

On my morning walk not too long ago, I nearly tripped over a small, lonely dog meandering down the road. There was no sign of his owner, just a name tag engraved with "Smeagie" attached to his collar. I really did feel bad for the poor fella, out there on his own. But... I left him. I just couldn't bring myself to take him home with me! There was something... off about his eyes... his piercing blank stare, it still haunts me.
Moo-hoo!

Back in the day, I wanted to help out the store I worked at, so I brought in my Cowplant to attract customers. You know, spark some interest with something dangerous and exciting! I didn't know it would get so out of hand. A bigger Cowplant meant more customers, so nightly feedings were a must. It grew and grew, and as it grew, it wanted more. I couldn't supply its demands, so it began EATING customers! It even ate the owner! I knew my Cowplant had to be stopped, so I enlisted help in making sure it was sent to a secret place where it could never hurt another Sim. I couldn't let my Cowplant just take over the world. That was one mean, green monster.
In a Pickle

I truly, deeply, irrevocably, hate pickles. I just do! I hate them. They're so sour in the most face-contorting way. And yet, I still eat them. I eat them because sometimes my friends or my family will say they don't like pickles, so I take them! I just wanted to be helpful, feel useful for once. Maybe it was also to prove a point. I didn’t want people to think I was the type of person who hates pickles! And now I take on the burden of the pickle... everyone thinks I love them. Every birthday I end up with pickle memorabilia, monthly pickle club memberships, homemade pickles, even pickles imported from alien planets. It never ends! Now all I have is a closet full of pickles and a stomach full of lies.
Sock It to Me

A secret like this should never get out. It's one the public would be up in arms over! Or should I say, up in feet over? I'm just a collector. It's no big deal. Sure, it's collecting socks, and sure it's collecting socks that aren't mine, but how is that a crime? I find them in the Lost & Found at different places around town, it's completely harmless! I just love the patterns, the fabrics, the ankle height. Argyle, polka dot, stripes. Ankle, knee high, crew. Mismatched or a pair, they are a delight!
Gummy Tummy

Since the dawn of time, gummy bear pancakes have been regarded as a delicacy enjoyed by all. That notion ends today. I don’t care if I’m the only one that thinks this! I will meet Grim on this hill alone! Gummy bear pancakes are disgusting! The gooeyness of the bear and the fluffiness of the pancake just don't work together! And oftentimes, the bears just burn or remain gelatinous, a hard chew within an otherwise light and airy breakfast bite. Everyone would think I'm crazy if they knew. Ever since I was small, I pretended to enjoy these gummy goobers as it brought smiles to my family's faces. The guilt of crushing their happiness was too much, the possibility of alienating myself with this opinion too grand. And now you know, but it must stay between us. Could you imagine the potential outrage over such a controversial topic?!
None of Your Biscuits

It's been said my family are descendants of Lord Reginald Wainscott Stickywyck von Dosenwald. Before his nautical voyages, it was rumored that he had several relationships throughout his early years. I've traced my ancestry back enough that I can almost find a connection that could link us together. Which seems pretty definite to me. But I don't want word to get out! I'd hate to be treated differently just because my ancestor was the 37th Earl of Biscuit! I just... want to be treated normal, like everyone else.
Tiger Tantrum

The Sanctuary in Tomarang has been open for as long as I can remember. As a small child, I would beg to visit every weekend. One visit in particular, I saw a small cub stumbling around. At that moment, I knew I wanted to take him home with me. I screamed and kicked and cried, begging for a baby tiger of my own. My parents thought it would be a good idea to get me a pet cat instead. I named him Mr. Tiddlywinks. And he looked just like a tiger! Oh, how I loved him. And then one day, my good 'ol kid brain decided it was time for Mr. Tiddlywinks to return to the forest. Never teach a child Rehabilitation and Release unless you specify you shouldn't do it to your house pets! I like to imagine Mr. Tiddlywinks is living high and mighty these days with his tiger pack. He was a menace, but he was my menace. Just… don’t tell anyone I abandoned my cat in the forest! I was just a kid, I didn’t know any better!
The Relentless Allure of Grilled Cheese

When I was very young, I had a strict teacher at school, Mr. Cousland, that seemed to enjoy assigning way too much homework, and giving grades that were way too low. He was a royal pain! One week, I happened to have grilled cheese for lunch a few times. Mr. Cousland came up to me during lunch and told me I should be careful. If I eat too many grilled cheeses, it would change me forever. And he said of all the people he knew, I would be the one most likely to fall down that slippery slope. I scoffed in his face and told him he was full of it, which earned me detention and extra homework. For years, I didn't believe him. Until one day I felt it, after having grilled cheese for lunch, dinner, and a midnight snack, the sensation hit me like a load of bricks. It was calling to me, the golden, glistening, cheesy, crunchy delicacy. Like it was floating in the sky and begging me to fly to it. I wrested control of myself at that moment. But I couldn't believe it, Mr. Cousland was right about grilled cheese, and he was right about me. He knew my weakness, and now so do you.
Not so Merry

When it comes to receiving gifts, I'm much harder to please than most. What can I say? I just have unique tastes! Regardless of my personal pickiness, there are also a lot of mediocre (or even straight up terrible) gifts out there. So yeah, maybe I did repurpose a few of those disappointing gifts I received. I turned them into gifts for others! Sometimes I even give the gift back to the person who gave it to me, after enough time has passed. It's just efficient, and they hardly ever notice. You know what they say, one Sim's trash is another Sim's treasure! Just, uh, maybe keep this to yourself. I wouldn't want anyone to know I'm a serial re-gifter!
Belle of the Eyeball

There are these rings I see folks wearing around town. They're... odd, to say the least. It's not just how they look. It's how they look, if you know what I mean. They appear to be looking at me, and only me, every time I see them. The eyes follow me. Listen, it wouldn't be such a big issue if only one other Sim had this ring... but they're everywhere, at least to me. And when I close my eyes, these rings are all I can see. I'm never alone! The rings will never leave! I've been having nightmares about them, and lately they've been escalating. In the last dream I had, I saw myself wearing one of them. It sent a chill down my spine. I would NEVER let those rings get to me like that... would I?
Sinking Feeling

I'm trying to be better about this, so don't judge me! But really, so what if I've washed a few dishes in the bathroom sink every now and then? In the end, a sink's a sink. It's not like it's any less sanitary than the kitchen sink! Whether or not you believe me, I can assure you that there were very good reasons for me to do this. You just wouldn't understand.
Ripped Pants

History class, third period, I was in the front row. I remember it like it was yesterday... My teacher, Ms. Sakamoto, asked each of us to give an impromptu speech on the history of Princess Cordelia. Naturally, I was a bit nervous, but nothing could have prepared me for what happened next. As I stood from my desk, I heard a terrifying RRRRRRRIP as the seat of my jeans split open in front of everyone! And to top it all off, I was wearing an embarrassing pair of old Voidcritter undies (because yes, it was laundry day!) It was mortifying! I swear I can still hear the cackling of my classmates in my nightmares.
Toilet Terror

One day, when I was a child, I was overcome with a glorious wave of playfulness. I wanted to get into the most raucous mischief I could imagine. So... I set up a prank on the toilet in our house. Admittedly, I didn't find it that fun at the beginning. But once I heard the horrified screech of the first prank recipient, I couldn't get enough. I set that prank up on that toilet every day. I became an expert toilet prankster. Whether family or visitors, our toilet was sending streams of water into the faces of everyone who dared to use it. I even pretended to be fooled by it, and was never found out. So... let's keep it that way. I haven't done it in years anyways!
Feeling Bleak in Willow Creek

You know what, I'm just so tired of hearing everyone talk about Willow Creek all the time. It's always "Willow Creek this" and "Willow Creek that!" I can't stand it anymore! I hate Willow Creek! I've spent way too much time there. But to me, even one minute is too long. It's just so... willow-y. And way too creek-y. You know that "grass is greener on the other side" saying? What if the grass in Willow Creek is a little too green? Ever think about that?!
Crumb-y Friend

Yeah, it's true. I've put plenty of bags of chips back when I've eaten all the whole chips, leaving just the fractured pieces and crumbs for everyone else. I don't care! I only want the full chips! If you want your own full chips from the top of the bag, go get your own bag of chips. I just can't be bothered to care, honestly. But... I wouldn't actually want anyone to know I do that on the regular. Don't tell on me!
Kettle Full of Lies

Growing up, my friend Ann had an electric kettle. It was very cute, and she'd even painted a little panther (her favorite animal) on the side of it! One day, I was struck with the inspiration to add something to the painted panther. So I grabbed a nearby pen and added an extra tooth sticking out of its mouth, between the usual 2 fangs. But the thing is, I didn't know how to draw a panther fang, so it looked more like a human tooth. I was so embarrassed! I pretended not to notice it when her mom brewed us some tea. The next time I was at her house, I felt that familiar strike of inspiration, and added another (once again, way too human-looking) tooth sticking out of its mouth. This happened again and again, until the day Ann finally noticed, when the panther looked like it was smiling with a mouth full of human teeth. She screamed in horror, wondering if a ghost had done it. I couldn't bear to tell her the truth. We don't speak anymore, but to this day I shudder to think of how she'd react if she knew it was me!
Hopscotch Hooligan

All of the kids in my neighborhood used to play hopscotch together for hours and hours. It got way too competitive! Friendships were forged and destroyed, egos (and sometimes shins) were bruised, and legends were made. One day, I was facing Kenny, the most fearsome hopscotch opponent on the block. I kept a watchful eye on Kenny, and when he looked away for a split second, I fudged my hops a bit, making it a little bit easier for me. Thankfully no one else noticed. I ended up winning, and becoming the new #1 Hopscotcher in our neighborhood. And I was never dethroned. I'm still proud of that title today, no matter what! I don't know what I'd do if anyone found out I was a fraud.
Grim Jealousy

Have you seen him? The Grim Reaper, I mean. He's just so elegant, isn't he? He's well-dressed, mysterious, and he's got just enough skeletons in his closet to keep things interesting for eternity. He's got it all! I mean, watching him work can be so magnificent. When he whips out that tablet, it always dazzles me. I would tickle a Cowplant for one fraction of the style and charm Grim possesses. Isn't his aura just so magnetic? It's like it's drawing all of us slowly towards him with every passing minute. Ugh, I wish I was as cool as Grim...
Liar! Liar! Pants on Fire!

Fire is such a powerful thing. It grants us the ability to create delicious foods and interesting inventions. But it also threatens us with the possibility of destruction and demise. And yet, for some reason, I can't help but think its destructive nature is beautiful, in a way. Sometimes when I'm cooking on the stove or the grill, I almost wish my culinary creation would catch fire so I can see those beautiful flames once again, just to keep things a little spicy, you know? I mean... I would never let my pancakes catch fire on purpose! Never ever!
Secret Llamas

When I was in elementary school, I started to harbor a growing disdain for authority. It would get so tiring following all the rules, all the time! So, in art class, I started only drawing llamas. Llamas ice skating, llamas going shopping, llama firefighters. My art teacher was furious, and told me I had to draw something different from now on. I was livid! How dare she intrude upon my creative process! So I hid a llama in every subsequent piece of I made. On the surface, it could be a painting of a rainbow. But take a closer look, and the brush strokes reveal a million tiny llamas inside of the rainbow. I even etched a super detailed llama on the bottom of the vase I sculpted during the pottery unit! Thankfully, no one had ever noticed. It's always been my little llama-shaped secret.
Interstellar Interloper

When I learned how to walk as a toddler, I had a penchant for walking into trouble. One day, I found a big metal tube in my neighbor's backyard. He was fixing something on it, and didn't notice when I toddled my way through the open door on its side. Of course I'd brought my favorite toy with me, and was happily playing with it while tucked away in a little corner. Well, little did I know, this tube was actually a ROCKET SHIP that my astronaut neighbor was tuning up right before his next trip to space. But when the floor started rumbling beneath me, and the light suddenly changed around me, I managed to hop over to the window, and saw myself surrounded by the stars. It was incredible, but I knew I'd get in huge trouble if I was found. So I hid in a different little nook, with a nice view of the window, playing with my toy as I watched the stars and planets soar by. When we finally landed, I managed to sneak my way out and waddle home just in time for dinner. Somehow, no one noticed!
Aiding and Abetting

There's someone I see in my neighborhood, he walks by every now and then. The other day, I noticed he carries a different color briefcase every day. This seemed odd to me, like who owns that many briefcases? I let curiosity get the better of me, and followed him at a distance after I saw him walk by the next day. We walked for what felt like hours, until finally he dropped the briefcase on a bench in Oasis Springs. I looked, and didn't see anyone else around. So I snatched the briefcase and ran. When I got home, I opened it to find stacks and stacks of Simoleons! That guy must be a really successful criminal! I panicked, and ran as fast as I could, briefcase in hand. I ended up throwing it into the canal in Willow Creek. If anyone finds out, I could get in trouble, or worse, get on the bad side of a local criminal!
Fruitcake Fumble

Greeting a new neighbor is supposed to make for an exciting day, but for me, it turned out to be one of the most embarrassing days of my life! I mean, you simply must bring a fruitcake to welcome a new neighbor... I can't imagine not doing it. How else will you help them feel at ease in their new home? But that day, I managed to bake one of the worst fruitcakes ever made. Listen, in my defense, the sun was in my eyes! So of course I couldn't see that I was measuring out a cup of salt, not sugar! You have to believe me!
Trashy Habit

You're telling me you've never gone over to a neighbor's house to use their trashcan? Taking out the trash can be such a hassle sometimes. All I want to do is get rid of all these gross water cups my houseguests left everywhere, or maybe a spoiled grilled cheese once in a while! Sometimes I can't even be bothered to wash those dishes, I just need them gone! So if my trash is full, I'll just pop over to their trashcan real quick and drop all the dishes in. They've never noticed anyways!
My Funds Magically Rose, Bud!

Listen, I don't know where those extra Simoleons came from. It felt like it happened in an instant. One day, I checked my account and saw all my funds were normal, as expected. A few hours later, I'd randomly acquired thousands of Simoleons out of nowhere! It must have been an accounting error or something, I swear I didn't steal them! I was so nervous, I panicked and spent it all on a bunch of new furniture to hide the evidence. If anyone finds out, they'll assume I'm a thief!
Serial Decliner

Every day, it feels like my phone won't stop ringing with text message after text message from Sims I know wanting to hang out. Somehow there's always new places to check out in town, out of town, everywhere! I'd bet if there was another planet that had a cool hangout spot, they'd throw me in the rocket and blast off right now if they could! But I'm just... tired. Sometimes it's been a long day, and I just want to chill, work on myself, or take a load off. I promise I care about my friends (and minor acquaintances!) But I've got better things to do 90% of the time!
Pool of Terror

I have this recurring nightmare about a swimming pool with walls so slippery, it's impossible to climb them to get out of the pool. The only place you can exit the pool is via a single ladder, and it always suddenly disappears as I'm swimming my way towards it, leaving me stranded in the pool. Hours pass, it's getting darker outside, I'm exhausted and hungry. My friends and family come and go, passing me by, yet none of them even seem to notice that I'm stuck, let alone help me out of the pool.\nTerrifying, right? Well, lately the dreams have been so vivid, I've started sleepwalking. The other day I woke up floating in a random pool in my neighborhood, wrapped up in my wet blanket like a burrito! It was humiliating!
Coffee Con-noisseur

It started out innocent, although I'm sure that's what they all say. One morning, while I was waiting for my order at the coffee shop, the barista called out what I thought was my name. Grabbing the cup, I soon realized I was off by about... 6 letters. But I’d already taken the coffee, made eye contact with the barista, acknowledging confidently that it was mine. When I returned, she remembered me! Soon everyone at that coffee shop knew me by this false name. And I kept going, and I kept taking this person's coffee. That's when things really flew off the rails. I was recognized in public by this new name. Over time it became hard to differentiate this persona from my real life. What's next, a long lost spouse? Kids?! Who knows! Good coffee, though.
Oh Baby, A Challenge!

Is it really that crazy to dream of having an expansive family? Listen, I'm not a horrible person to want to have children with different partners. I can name at least 5 other Sims that have done it! I'd raise those kids right and make sure they didn't grow up too fast. I'd have plenty of parental help to go around, too. Sure, juggling multiple relationships in various stages sounds overwhelming. But I’ve never been one to stray from a challenge.
Now I'm a Bear-liever

Those rockets are dangerous, sure, but if you launch up to space in one, and everything lines up just right, you can crest ever-so-slightly above the moon's orbital proximity. Time it correctly, and you can witness the greatest sight known to Sim-kind. MOON BEARS. That’s right! There are terrifying bears on the moon, I’ve seen them myself. What... you don't believe me? Listen, they don't want anyone to know about those galactic quadrupeds! The things I saw when I was up there, it haunts me. But you can’t tell anyone! If this gets out... I can't go back there! They can't take me back there!
Being Grim

Soul reaping is not for the faint of heart. When you've been around as long as I have, you've witnessed a series of fateful events. But even as death, I have lived a full life. I have loved. I have lost. There are times where I have pitied and obliged. And times where I have been downright medieval. I even owned a cowboy hat once, although I'm not sure where I put it. Unfortunate for you, death's secret is not one I can share. Mere mortals learning of such things before their time would be a grave mistake. One that would haunt you 'till the end of days! But I will leave you with this - rest up before you rest in peace, the afterlife can be quite lively.
Mold Ghosts don't eat their mushroom-kin!

A Sim who’s experienced enough of life to know what really matters. These Sims enjoy reminiscing and sharing life’s wisdom, making them excellent Mentors for those willing to listen. Their years of experience allow them to naturally learn new Skills with ease, and their emotional intelligence reduces their angry and uncomfortable thoughts.
For Rent

To more easily determine which rooms are assigned to which unit, you can toggle Unit Outlines on in Build Mode. The color of each unit's outline can be customized via the Unit Info tab of the Unit Configuration menu. Unit Outlines can also be toggled off if needed!

By default, units other than the one currently loaded into will be hidden in Build Mode. Units must be unhidden to edit them. To unhide unoccupied units, click the Hide/Unhide button on either the Unit Legend, or on the Unit Configuration panel. You can also opt to hide units as you build. Just keep in mind it must be unhidden to edit it again.\n\nNote that units occupied by other Households will not be editable unless playing as that Household.

Once you've created a unit, you can edit it via the Unit Configuration panel, located under the Venue Info menu. Each unit listed will have two tabs. The first tab is Unit Info, where you can rename your units, check value or dimensions of the unit, update the bedroom/bathroom count, hide/unhide the unit, or delete the unit. When converting an owned Residential lot to a Residential Rental lot, and assigning units for the first time, you can also select which unit belongs to the current active Household by checking the Home Unit box on the appropriate unit section. The second tab is Unit Traits and Challenges, which can be customized per unit to create unique living experiences within the same Residential Rental.

Assigning a room to Shared via the block menu designates that room to be available for Households living in any unit. This might serve the purpose of apartment building lobbies, hallways, mail rooms, shared kitchens or bathrooms, or whatever you'd like! Rooms assigned to units not currently lived in by the active Household will be unloaded and inaccessible unless traveled to. Areas that aren't part of selectable rooms, including all outdoor area, is automatically considered Shared space.\n\nWhen creating a Residential Rental with many units, it's important to create accessible space leading to the entrance of each unit. Whether it's via shared hallways, or perhaps outdoors entrances, it's important for your Sims to be able to reach their unit!

Residential Rental unit assignments are handled by room. To assign a room to a unit, select the room and open the dropdown from the menu. You can assign that room to an existing unit, or create a new unit to assign it to.\n\nIt's important to note that there must be at least one room assigned to the first unit in order to create additional units.

To create your own Residential Rental, simply choose the lot you wish to build on, enter Build Mode, and change its Lot Type to Residential Rental. This can be done for both unowned lots and lots with Sims already living on them. Note that the Household occupying a Residential lot will automatically become the Property Owner Household upon converting to a Residential Rental. Your Sims can also purchase a Residential Rental via the Phone or the Owned Businesses panel which will automatically convert the lot purchased to a Residential Rental! Once the lot is converted, you're ready to start creating and assigning units!
Building Residential Rentals

What if you're a Property Owner and you don't want a Tenant in your Rental Unit anymore? You can always Evict them! There are Just and Unjust Evictions.\n\nThe distinction between a Just and Unjust Eviction is important. Just Evictions carry no repercussions, while Unjust ones will harm the Property Owner's relationship with the Tenant, lower the Unit Rating, and potentially lead to an Eviction settlement, costing additional Simoleons for the Property Owner. An Eviction is considered Just when a Tenant has broken their Unit Rules, failed to pay rent, or their Lease Term is up.

So how do you Evict a Sim? In Live Mode, you can travel to your Rental Unit or invite your Tenant to your lot. After introducing your Property Owner to the Tenant, there should be a new Social Pie Menu Category called Rental. Within that menu is the interaction for Unjustly Evict or Justly Evict. Select the interaction and choose to Evict them in the following prompt—assuming you still want to.

As a Property Owner, you don't have to actually interact with your Tenant to Evict them. If you'd like to Evict them through a menu, while in Live Mode go to the bottom right of the screen to the Owned Businesses Panel. View your Tenant's Tenant Agreement. In this menu, there is an option to Evict the Tenant Household at the bottom left of the screen. Select this button and follow through.

Whether you're a Tenant or a Property Owner, Rental Unit Rules, Fines, and Evictions are something to take note of! When playing as a Tenant you can be Fined or Evicted if you don't follow the rules or pay rent, and playing as a Property Owner you can Fine a Tenant when they break a Rule or Evict a Tenant at any time! Read on to learn more.

Playing as a Tenant is a little simpler than playing as a Property Owner when it comes to Eviction. A Property Owner will only attempt to Evict your Household if you break Rental Unit Rules or fail to pay rent on time. The chance of getting Evicted increases for each Rule that is actively broken.\n\nIf the time does come, however, that your Household is Evicted, you have a short period of time where you can attempt to convince your Property Owner to let you stay. Go to the Rental pie menu social category and choose to Plead to Stay or Intimidate to Stay. There's a chance the Eviction might be revoked with a fine. Depending on your Property Owner's Personality Traits, they may even be more or less likely to show leniency!

Property Owners can collect fines for any active broken rules shown in the Tenant Agreement. When you are notified of a rule break for any of the units you own, you can visit the unit to Prosecute Fine or you can use the mailbox or door to Deliver Fine remotely! If you are a Tenant Sim, when a rule violation takes place you will be immediately notified. Make sure to invite the Property Owner inside when they arrive at your unit angry! Promptly selecting the Property Owner Sim to Pay Fine will help avoid further consequences. If you believe that certain Unit Rules are unfair, you can also attempt to Negotiate or Discuss a Rule Change with the Property Owner.
Enforcing Rules & Eviction

For Rent let's you enjoy the flexibility of multi-unit lot living anywhere—whether your story is about a Tenant or Property Owner. In this pack, you'll own and manage multiple Residential Rentals or simply live in a home with neighbors who are closer than ever! From wild Emergency Events and Snooping to Pool Party or Potluck events and Evictions there's bound to be plenty of fun (or drama) for the whole family to experience.
Getting Started

Once you have created your units or purchased a Residential Rental lot, you can head into the Owned Businesses Panel to Fill Vacancy for the unoccupied units. Before you move in your Tenant households, make sure to set the Lease Length and Rent Per Day of the particular unit. The Max Rent indicates the maximum amount of rent you can charge for the unit. You can also set Unit Rules, which the Tenant Household must abide by. Make sure to set Unit Rules and finalize your Rent Per Day before moving in your Tenants, as altering these lease details after they have already moved in, with exceptions to the Grace Period window, will result in an unsatisfied Tenant household and lower your Unit Ratings.

You can become a Property Owner by opening the Owned Businesses panel and selecting Buy Residential Rental. You can buy an empty lot in any world to convert the lot type into a Residential Rental. If you wish to sell your Residential Rental lot, simply select Sell Residential Rental which can be done on the Owned Businesses panel or through Manage Worlds. Selling your lot will not move out the existing households, but will immediately replace them with a new Property Owner. The Owned Businesses Panel will display all of your owned units as well as your home unit if you are a Property Owner living in a Residential Rental.

The Owned Businesses panel shows the daily amount of rent that will sum up to be collected on pay day as well as any additional Unit Taxes that you as a Property Owner owe. Running a Residential Rental business has costs and will charge more tax based on the number of units you own. You can open up the Show Bills Information on the phone to see additional details of your bills and taxes.

Four categories combine to determine the Unit's Rating, where each category has three levels of quality that range from low to high. The following three categories are directly impacted from Build Mode changes: • Size represents the total number of tiles within the unit. Building a larger unit will result in a higher rating. • Amenities are determined by the objects placed in the unit and shared spaces. Adding objects from Build Mode, such as beds, toilets, showers/bathtubs, skill/hobby activities, and appliances, will enhance the quality of this category. • Environment is calculated based on the number of décor objects with an environment attribute placed in the unit. A well-decorated unit will achieve a higher Unit Rating.

Unit Rating is important to keep track of as a Property Owner, as it directly affects the unit's ability to attract high-paying Tenants and more Sims will be interested in moving into the unit. A highly rated unit not only benefits Property Owners but also ensures a better quality of life for the Tenants. You can easily track changes in Unit Rating for each unit by observing the dynamically changing up and down arrows displayed on the Owned Businesses panel.
Property Owners can also Evict Sims either Justly or Unjustly. See the Lessons section on Enforcing Rules & Eviction to learn more.

The Maintenance category is directly influenced by Live Mode events that occur in shared spaces and within the unit. Hosting Social Events with a gold medal reward will positively impact the Unit's Rating. Resolving Emergency and Maintenance Events, contributing to Community Events, interacting positively with your neighbor Tenants, and maintaining your unit will all boost the Maintenance category.

After you've set the lease details in the Tenant Agreement, select the arrow button to proceed to the Tenant Applications. In the applications panel, you'll find all the households interested in occupying this unit. Pay close attention to their Beds Wanted count; it's highly recommended to select a household whose preferences match the unit's specifications. The Rent Cap represents the maximum rent amount this household can afford. If the set Rent Per Day exceeds the household's Rent Cap, they won't be eligible for moving in. Look for households with green checkmarks in both fields, indicating that they meet the qualifications for moving in. Once you've chosen the Tenant household, select the checkmark on the bottom right to immediately move them in!

Life as a Property Owner requires diligence and extra care! But you can manage your business completely remotely by taking advantage of the phone or mailbox. Head over to the mailbox to 'Post Fine' for any of the broken rules, or 'Post Rent Demand' for any overdue rent you need to collect. When an event unfolds you can call an expensive or cheap contractor to resolve the problem for you instead!\n\nIf you desire closer relationships with your Tenants, visit the unit! You can do this by selecting the 'Travel to Unit' button on the 'Owned Businesses Panel.' This provides an opportunity for regular inspections and maintenance of the units and shared spaces.
Residential Rental Property Ownership

Maintenance and Emergency Events can now outbreak in Residential Rental units! It's important to address these events when they happen, as failing to take action will result in your Unit Rating to fall. Property Owners can Call a Contractor over the phone or visit the active unit with the event to solve the problem! Tenants can also call the Property Owner over during an event, or take initiative by successfully completing one of the goals of the event.\n\nIf you'd like to turn off events, untoggle Rental Unit Events under Pack Settings in the Options Menu. Maintenance and Emergency Events can also happen in regular Residential lots with the new Lot Challenge! Simply turn on Maintenance Troubles as a Lot Challenge to encounter active events in regular Residential lots.

You can explore neighboring Tenant units by choosing Visit Unit, accessible from the Tenant unit's door. If you wish to play as a different neighbor unit or the Property Owner's household, select 'Switch Control to this Household'. Neighbor Tenants often make good use of the amenities and communal objects found in shared spaces. Make the most of these shared spaces to build strong bonds and socialize with your neighbors. Consider hosting Social Events to further strengthen your community and bring your neighbors closer together!

The Grace Period is a one-day window after the lease length resets, allowing you to move out, evict, or increase rent without an impact to Unit Rating. If you wish to move your Tenant Household out of a unit during Grace Period, simply select 'Justly Evict' on the Tenant Agreement. You can also change Rent Per Day freely during this time.

Each Residential Rental unit includes a Tenant Agreement set by the Property Owner that offers comprehensive insights into your lease. To access this agreement as a Tenant, simply navigate to the 'Home' category on your Phone or Computer and select Show Tenant Agreement. Here's what you'll find in the Tenant Agreement: 1. Rent Per Day: This figure represents your daily rent amount. Your total rent due is calculated weekly on Pay Day. 2. Lease Length: This denotes the duration of your lease before the Grace Period becomes active. During this Grace Period, you can move out without facing any consequences. 3. Unit Rules: All active rules for the unit are listed here, outlining the guidelines you must adhere to. Any infractions and associated fines are also displayed in this section. 4. Unit Rating: The unit's rating is displayed, impacting the overall quality of your residential experience.

Unit Rules are set by the Property Owner and must be abided by Tenants living in the unit. Violating any active rules will result in fines that you must pay to the Property Owner. You can select the Property Owner and Pay Fine for any of the broken rules. Make sure to avoid breaking too many rules, as it could result in an Eviction!

Community Events are a part of life in Residential Rentals. Connect with your neighbors through uplifting events like the Pet Adoption Drive or join in to improve your Residential Rental during Maintenance Day! Keep in mind that negative Community Events may arise if living conditions deteriorate. You can even suggest hosting certain Community Events by interacting with your neighbor Tenant Sims!

Pay Day occurs weekly, notifying the Tenant Household of the total rent owed to the Property Owner. When it's time to pay rent, head over to the mailbox or select the Property Owner Sim, then choose Pay Rent. If needed, you can also try to Negotiate Rent Forgiveness. However, it's crucial to take action on Pay Day because unpaid rent carries consequences that may ultimately result in Eviction!

A household who is living as a Tenant in a Rental Unit can also be Evicted! This will happen when they break rules or are late paying rent. See the Lessons section on Enforcing Rules & Eviction to learn more.
Life in a Residential Rental

Mold Ghosts have become one with Mold in death. They have special abilities which allow them to Spoil Food, Blow Fertilizing Spores on plants, and Create Fungal Overgrowth to spawn mushrooms! They also enjoy talking to plants (and especially mushrooms) and hate it when their "mushroom-kin" are eaten nearby. Watch out though, they might also inadvertently spawn Allergenic Mold piles as they float around.

Allergenic Mold Piles will make a Sim feel Dazed, but Toxic Mold Piles are actually pretty deadly to Teens and older. They'll need to be address quickly or else a Sim could die and become a Death by Mold Ghost.

Mold is a new Lot Challenge available with For Rent. This Lot Challenge can be placed on any Residential or Residential Rental lot in the Traits Panel in Build Mode. Adding this Lot Challenge will allow Allergenic and Toxic Mold Piles to spawn when a nearby plumbing object is dirty, there is a puddle on the floor, or trash is overflowing.

The best way to deal with Mold is by preventing it in the first place. Keep your space and plumbing objects clean! If, however, mold does appear you can deal with it in a handful of ways. Mold can always be cleaned the classic way—each pile at a time. The quickest but most expensive way is with a Mold-B-Gone Bomb. While environmentally friendly, these do cost extra money! For those who enjoy chaotic moments though, you really can't do better than choosing to purge the mold with fire. Good luck!
Mold Lot Challenge

Tomarang is comprised of two neighborhoods and the people within have a rich culture and a strong sense of community. Delicious Tomarani Cuisine, vibrant dances, and games help to bring the neighbors together and are just a few of the things found here. A deep appreciation for local legend, history, and the regions’ natural wonders is a must. Keep an eye out for limited edition Marbles or brightly colored Tassels as you venture forth!

Morensong is a bustling city center. Sims come together during the day with their families to play games like Hopscotch or Marbles in shared spaces. In the evening, many treasures are waiting to be found at the Night Market—whether it’s community, tasty dishes, or trinkets, Sims are sure to find what they’re looking for. The area is richly adorned with statuary, walkways, and beautiful architecture. Be sure to stop by Tinsu Temple as well.

Located along the seaside, in the bustling neighborhood of Morensong, the Night Market boasts a variety of experiences for locals and tourists alike. From 6pm to 2am, the Night Market illuminates the streets, offering famous Tomarani Cuisine that will satisfy all. Surround yourself with many enticing dishes to choose from, including vegetarian options, traditional drinks, and delicious desserts. Food is not the only thing that can be found here! Peruse clothing, unique trinkets, and hidden treasures sold by local vendors. No Night Market would be complete without the freshest fish, so don’t skip out on the Fish Market where a Sim can purchase the catch of the day!

Life moves a little more slowly on this side of town. Koh Sahpa is a fishing hub for Tomarang and is nestled within the water ways and dense forests. It is home to the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary, where Sims can donate and support the local tiger population. Visit the Sanctuary for more information about the conservation efforts here or come back in the evening for more... sneaky activities. Enjoy nature by going for a swim or exploring the cavernous depths of Beard Beard Cove. This is also a great place to release a Sky Lantern for a Child of the Village Sim, though that can be done anywhere outdoors.
Welcome to Tomarang

Once your Sim has discovered a Secret about another Sim, your Sim can Confront them about it, making it known that they learned the Secret.\n\nOnce they've Confronted the Sim with the Secret, your Sim has two options. They can either choose the Friendly route and promise to keep the Secret, or they could choose to be Mean and Blackmail the Sim whose Secret they learned for sweet Simoleons! Though, the Sim with the Secret might not be so happy to have to pay for your silence...

Your Sim's neighbors have Secrets and they're ready to be discovered! There are several ways to discover a Sim's Secrets. Your Sim can choose to Eavesdrop on a neighbor's door or Eavesdrop on conversations between two other Sims. Additionally, Sims can find Secrets by sifting through a Sim's belongings such as bookshelves, computers, mailboxes, or trashcans.\n\nFor a more risky means of uncovering a Secret, your Sim can travel to a neighbor's home and start a Break-In!

Break-Ins are a special event where your Sim has the opportunity to break into a neighbor's home, starting with getting that pesky front door opened. Once broken in, your Sim has free reign of the house until the owners return. Feel free to make use of the amenities, but you might also want to opt for Snooping on certain belongings, such as bookshelves, computers, mailboxes, or trashcans. Doing so will allow your Sim to discover Secrets about Sims that live there! Just make sure to keep an eye on the time remaining before the homeowners return, as they will not be very happy to discover someone breaking into their home!
Secrets learned can be viewed on the corresponding Sim's Profile panel. You can view the Secrets your Sim has learned about them and their current status.
Snooping & Neighborhood Secrets
For Rent also comes with two different Radiators and a Wall-Mounted Air Conditioner Unit. These objects can be turned on or off and help keep a space nice and tosty or nice and cool.

If you aren't interested in the maintenance or gameplay that comes with the Water Heater, Solar Water Heater, or Electrical Fuse Box then there are decoration-only versions of these objects that you can place down simply for décor. These objects are called Non-Functional Water Heater, Non-Functional Solar Water Heater, and Non-Functional Electrical Fuse Box.

The Solar Water Heater is a more hands-off option if you're looking to ensure your water stays warm. It won't ever break and doesn't require maintenance, but this object also will only function when the sun is out and bright. If you don't mind cold showers after the sun goes down, this might be a great option.

There are some very fun utility objects in For Rent that spice up gameplay. One of those is the Water Heater. So long as there is at least one working Water Heater on a lot, your Household's water will stay warm. If all Water Heaters are broken or turned off (due to missing Plumbing or Electric utility), water will be very chilly and uncomfortable. Over time, a Water Heater will degrade and eventually break. To ensure that never happens, you can always Perform Maintenance on it to keep it in tip-top shape!\n\nWater Heaters can also be Upgraded to improve their functionality. The Robustify Inner Workings upgrade will ensure your Water Heater needs less maintenance. While the 5EverWarm Tech upgrade will allow your Water Heater to function Off-the-Grid without Plumbing or Electric utility (which is normally required for this object to function).

The Electrical Fuse Box is also a new utility object in For Rent. When this object is placed and working, electricity will be supplied to the lot or Rental Unit, and (as a nice bonus) it also ensures that the Power Utility spent on keeping electricity going will be more economical. Talk about a savings on Bills! When it isn't working, due to Power being turned off or the Electrical Fuse Box being broken, the lights will flicker—which is rather concerning for a Sim!\n\nJust like with the Water Heater, there is an option to Perform Maintenance on this object, which will help keep it in tip-top shape and ensure it doesn't break. If it does though, it can always be repaired. It can also be upgraded with the Robustify Inner Workings upgrade to ensure it breaks less often.

These objects function on Residential lots, but they also function on Residential Rental lots. If placed in a Rental Unit they will function just for that Rental Unit. If placed in a shared space, they will function for all Rental Units on that lot and the shared spaces.
Utility Objects

And there you have it, now you've become a Property Owner! The up and down arrows on the 'Owned Businesses' panel shows you any Unit Rating changes happening for that unit. Oh, and as a token of appreciation, I've given you the Knowledgeable Leaser reward trait viewable under the Simology panel! Thanks for learning!
To get started, let's find a home for your soon-to-be Property Owner Sim! Choose from the available Unoccupied Premade Homes or select an Empty Lot.
Select a Lot

Tenants require their own dedicated home known as Units, which define their individual living spaces. Additionally, there are communal areas, referred to as Shared spaces, that tenants from different units can also enjoy. You can designate existing rooms or create new ones! Let me show you how!
Now, let's open up the Owned Businesses panel to move in Tenants and set the lease details of your unit!
First off, select the Fill Vacancy button next to the unit you have created!

This is where you set the Tenant Agreement details of this unit! The Rent Per Day should be set to a value smaller than the Max Rent allowed for this unit. Keep in mind that the Unit Rating directly impacts the Max Rent, so the higher the Unit Rating, the more you can charge in rent!\n\nAdditionally, you can specify the Lease Length, which determines the time until the Grace Period begins. The Grace Period is a one-day window after the lease length ends, allowing you to Justly Evict tenants from this unit before the lease cycle renews.

Now, let's set the Unit Rules for this unit! Any rules you choose here must be followed strictly by the Tenant Household. Violating these rules will result in consequences, including fines that you can collect. Hover over the '?' to learn more!
Once you’re done setting up the details of the Agreement, click on the arrow button to find a Tenant Household to move into this Unit!

Here is the list of Tenant households interested in this unit! Pay close attention to their Rent Cap, which indicate the maximum Rent Per Day each Household is willing to pay. Your selected Rent Per Day must not surpass the Household's Rent Cap. Additional information is available over the '?' button!
Assign Rooms to Units

You must create or have a room block ready for your Sim to live in, including additional ones for your Tenant Households. When you have all room blocks ready, select one to access the Unit Assignment dropdown menu. Now, assign the selected room block as either Shared or Unit. Any additional units needed can be assigned by selecting Create Unit.
Venue Info

Select the Unit Configuration button to see what units are being created as you start assigning rooms. Explore this panel to further set traits and challenges for each unit. You can even open up the Suggestions menu to guide you on which objects help create a thriving Unit!
Unit Configuration
Select the Venue Info button to view the Lot Type selection menu.
Next, open up the dropdown menu labeled Venues, then choose Residential Rental to change the lot type.
Select Lot Type
Now comes the fun stuff! Let's assign some Units and Shared Spaces for your Tenants!
Moving On!
Select the Owned Businesses button first!
Buy a Residential Rental
Choose to Buy Residential Rental. This will take you to Manage Worlds to select a Residential Rental lot to purchase.
Set Up Your Residential Rental Business
Fill Vacancy
Set Up the Tenant Agreement
Find a Tenant Household to Move in
Alright then! First, select this button to enter Build Mode.
Go to Build Mode
Looks like you have decided to have only one unit on your own lot. Not a problem! You can always explore the help center and go through this onboarding again if you change your mind.
Single Unit Property Owner
Great choice! Let's click the Confirm Button to load into the selected lot.
Confirm Selected Lot

Now you have the freedom to choose any world, though I strongly recommend Tomarang for its vibrant Multi-Living lifestyle! Once you head into the selected world, choose a lot and confirm your purchase.
Select a World
Now it's time to purchase a Residential Rental lot! Select an existing premade Residential Rental or any Empty Lot.
Great choice! Let's select the Confirm Button to load into the selected lot.
Confirm Purchase
To get started, let's find a Residential Rental lot to move your household into! Choose from the available Unoccupied Premade Homes highlighted with the orange help center tag.

Now, you have the freedom to hover over the unoccupied units and choose the one that perfectly suits your household's needs. When you've made your selection, simply click the Confirm button located at the bottom right to initiate the move-in process.
Select a Unit

Neighbors with nature or other tenants, Koh Sahpa offers a more relaxed lifestyle along the river. After a dip in the sea or some much needed beach time, gather round at the Screaming Gecko for a drink or two. Feeling warm-hearted from all the sun? Visit The Sulea Tiger Sanctuary to support local conservation. No matter the choice, Koh Sahpa is the ideal spot for a go-with-the-flow attitude.
Koh Sahpa

A bustling neighborhood with pockets of idyllic peace and nooks of neighborly nuance! Morensong is the spot for vibrant communities to thrive, day or night. Stroll through the botanical garden or throw down in a game of playground hopscotch. Even join the Night Market buzz for some sunset shopping and moonlight munchies. The possibilities are endless!
